loans.name: Julia Lily

texts.es:
En el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Julia P. posee su propio negocio de venta de productos de madera como mesas, planchadores, utensilios de cocina, entre otros.

La razón por la que ella espera en Ceprodel es porque requiere el crédito para la compra de los productos de madera para comercializarla y así continuar adelante llevando el sustento a su familia.

loans.use: Compra de productos de madera

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, tiene 30 años y es madre de un pequeño, ella se dedica a la venta de plantones de ficus, cocos y plantas ornamentales, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien también se dedica a esta actividad. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” desde hace cuatro años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que invirtió en productos de belleza, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 1200 que será utilizado en la compra de abono y semillas  para el vivero. La  meta de María es comprar un terreno grande para aumentar la producción de sus plantas.
texts.en:
María is a hard-working woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district. She is 30 years old and has a young son. She sells fig and coconut seedlings, as well as decorative plants for a living. She has the support of her husband, who also works in this business. She has been a member of the “Manos Unidas” Microfinance Institute for 4 years. She invested her first loan in the amount of 300.00 PEN in beauty products. She currently needs a 1,200.00 PEN loan, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her nursery. María’s goal is to purchase a large plot of land in order to increase plant production.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer for nursery

loans.name: Verfalia Milania

texts.es:
La señora Verfalia I. se dedica a su negocio de venta de bisuterías en su propio establecimiento en el mercado de Chinandega. Entre las bisuterías que ella vende se encuentran aretes, pulceras, aros para cabellos, pañuelos y prensapelos.  

La razón por la que ella está solicitando el crédito es para la compra de dichas bisuterías y de esta manera continuar contribuyendo al bienestar de su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Verfalia I. is devoted to her business selling costume jewelry from her own vending post at the market in Chinandega. The types of costume jewelry she sells include earrings, bracelets, hair rings, scarves and hairclips.

The reason she is requesting the loan is to buy more costume jewelry so that she can continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase costume jewelry

loans.name: Dora Elizabeth

texts.es: Dora es una mujer jovial y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 23 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijito y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas ll” desde hace dos años, su primer crédito fue de 300 soles que invirtió en perfumes para damas, en la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que le permitirá invertir en productos de belleza, comprará cremas, perfumes, talcos, etc. La meta de Dora es tener un bazar bien implementado.

loans.use: Invertirá en productos de belleza, comprará cremas, perfumes, talcos, etc

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Felipe R. le está haciendo falta las protecciones pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora. 
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagarle a la persona que realizara y colocara las protecciones en las ventanas y puestas de su casa para que su familia esté más seguro cunado en este trabajando.
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su empleo de encargado de tráfico en una compañía de trasportes. Don Felipe ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente.
Cuando se realizo la visita a la casa del señor Felipe el se encontraba en su trabaja y quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Paola Talamantes quien es la persona que aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
The home of Sr. Felipe R. lacks protection, but he does not have the money at the moment to make improvements. He is requesting a loan to pay to have someone install windows and doors to his house so that his family will be more secure while he is at work.

He plans to repay the loan with his income as a traffic dispatcher for a shipping company. Don Felipe took out a previous loan with FVP and was punctual with his payments. When we visited his home, Don Felipe was at work, so his wife Sra. Paola Talamantes is the person who appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install windows & doors to provide protection for his home

loans.name: Carmenza

texts.es:
En el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Carmenza B. ha iniciado su pequeño negocio de venta de productos ferreteros pero no presa las condiciones necesarias y además requiere surtir el negocio para ofertar tales productos.

Ella muy sabiamente ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de los productos ferreteros y de esta manera ofertarlos y así ir ampliando poco a poco su negocio hasta convertirse en una excelente comerciante.

loans.use: Compra de productos ferreteros

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Gumercinda L. de 40 años esposa y madre de 7 hijos, hace 20 años se dedica a vender miel de abeja, tiene su puesto propio  en la ciudad de La Paz, zona San Francisco donde oferta su producto. Para comprar su mercadería viaja  a diferentes pueblos de lugares cálidos como Coripata, ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar un carrito que le permita trasladar su mercadería.
Al igual que Gumercinda las demás integrantes del grupo tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de refrescos, pescado, muebles, ropa, zapatos y miel y necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y activo fijo.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y ACTIVO FIJO

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo, la señora Martha M. se ha destacado por ser una excelente trabajadora que se dedica a atender su negocio de pulpería donde ofrece todo tipo de productos y en especial comestibles.

Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos productos y de esta manera continuar en su negocio buscando lograr la satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Martha M. has distinguished herself as an excellent and enthusiastic worker who is dedicated to her small general store where she offers all types of products, especially food products. She has turned to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase products for her store so that she can continue to run her business in a way that satisfies her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase products for a small general store

loans.name: Carmenza

texts.es:
En el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Carmenza B. ha iniciado su pequeño negocio de venta de productos ferreteros pero no presa las condiciones necesarias y además requiere surtir el negocio para ofertar tales productos.

Ella muy sabiamente ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de los productos ferreteros y de esta manera ofertarlos y así ir ampliando poco a poco su negocio hasta convertirse en una excelente comerciante.
texts.en:
In the Central Market of Chinandega, Sra. Carmenza B. started her small business selling hardware products. However, she does not have the necessary capital to restock her store so that she can continue offering these items.

She wisely requested a loan so that she could directly invest in the purchase of more hardware products. This will enable her to gradually expand her business so that she can become a good businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hardware products

loans.name: Clayton

texts.es:
El señor Clayton B. J. se ha destacado por ser muy trabajador puesto que se dedica al negocio de venta de granos básicos en su establecimiento propio en el mercado central del departamento de Chinandega.

El crédito lo ha solicitado para la compra de sal, trigo, arroz y frijoles ya que requiere tales productos para continuar ofertándolos y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su hogar que tanto requiere de su apoyo para desarrollarse.

loans.use: Compra de los granos básicos

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan V. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos pequeños a quien les quiere dar lo mejor.
Con sus ahorro pudo construir un cuarto que será para los niños, pero le está haciendo falta el techo y no cuenta ya con el dinero para la comprar del material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de la elaboración de la losa, es por eso que está solicitando el préstamo, ya que desea poner el techo de concreto para que sea mas seguro y duradero. 
Don Juan trabaja como empleado del municipio en la recolección de la basura en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, este es el ingreso que tiene para pagar el crédito, ya que también tiene el ingreso de las de comidas que vende su esposa.

loans.use: Colocación de la losa de concreto un cuarto

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Antonio C. es padre de familia y tiene un hijo pequeño de edad a quien le quiere dar lo mejor.
Con dos créditos anteriores que atenido con KIVA ha construido un cuarto pero le está haciendo falta el piso de concreto y los acabados para terminar el cuarto que será para su niño. Es por eso que nueva mente esta solicitando su cooperación para este nuevo préstamo y así terminar la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su empleo como técnico en una fabrica.

loans.use: Elaboración del piso de concreto y enjarres

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa tiene 33 años de edad, es separada y tiene a su cargo tres hijos de 11, 10 y 6 años de edad; viven en el distrito de Santa Rosa, ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La separación de su esposo la motivó a buscar trabajo hace tres años con la finalidad de sustentar a sus hijos, empezó con la venta de pescado en el terminal pesquero de la zona y continúa en esta actividad hasta la actualidad: junto a un grupo de vecinas suelen esperar en el muelle de Pimentel (Balneario ubicado a 10 minutos del distrito) a las embarcaciones que vienen al muelle luego de sus jornadas de pesca para comprarles pescado y venderlo luego en el terminal a diversos comerciantes de la región.

El negocio le brindó temporalmente los ingresos que necesitaba pero las continuas temporadas de veda la hicieron pensar en otro negocio con el cual seguir sustentando a su familia, fue así como instaló en su casa una pequeña bodega – tienda en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite); frutas, verduras y golosinas.

Este negocio es atendido por su hija mayor por las mañanas y por ella en las tardes; Tomasa aún vende pescado en el terminal pero sin captar los ingresos que antes percibía. Ella desea implementar su tiendita para dejar de vender pescado y dedicarle más tiempo a sus hijos; por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Tomasa desea incursionar con la venta de útiles escolares en su negocio, ya que en la zona en donde vive no existe ningún establecimiento de ese tipo y los niños del lugar (incluyendo a sus hijos) tienen que caminar hasta el centro de la ciudad para agenciarse de material de trabajo.

Este es su primer préstamo con Edpyme Alternativa, ella es muy conocida por sus vecinos los cuales la admiran y aprecian ya que es una mujer luchadora que ha sabido sacar adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 33 years old, is separated and takes care of her three children who are 11, 10 and 6 years old. They live in the district of Santa Rosa, located 25 minutes of the city of Chiclayo.

The separation from her husband motivated her to look for a job three years ago in order to support her children. She started selling fish in the fishing terminal and continues the activity to this day. Tomasa along with a group of her neighbors, usually wait in the Pimentel pier (Balneario some 10 minutes from the district) for the boats who come to the dock after their fishing workday ends to buy their fish and sell them later in the terminal to various merchants in the region.

The fishing business temporarily gave her the necessary funds to survive but the close season made her consider going into another business to keep supporting her family. She set up in her home a small grocery store, where she sells basic household goods (rice, sugar, and oil); fruits, vegetables and candy.

This business is taken care of by her eldest daughter in the mornings and by Tomasa in the afternoons. She still sells fish in the terminal but does not gain the same profit as before. She wishes to maintain her store and stop selling fish to dedicate more time to her children. This is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa (kiva’s field partner) for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that she will use to meet her goal.

Tomasa wishes to sell school supplies in her business as well, since the place where she lives there aren’t any businesses of this type and the children (including hers) have to walk to the center of the city to get their school supplies.

This will be her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. Tomasa is very well known by her neighbors who admire and value her since she is a hardworking woman who has been able to give her family a good start in life despite all their hardships.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and basic household goods to expand her business.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es:
El señor José Javier López es padre de familia y tiene cuatro hijos de deferente edad el deponer un techo de madera la frente de la casa para cubrirla del sol.
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabaja.
Don José Javier planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene por su trabaja como jardinero en una compañía.
texts.en:
José Javier López has four children of different ages. He needs to put a roof on the front of the house to cover it from the sun. That is why he is asking for a loan to buy the material. He will undertake the improvement with an additional schedule at work. José Javier plans to pay for the loan with the income he gets for his work as a gardener for a company.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put a wood roof on the front of the house

loans.name: 52 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
"Bái N. Thị (101) is 65 years old and lives in the town of Thanh Hóa. Bái is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 52 (052 Quảng Hưng).

Bái is married and has 2 adult children. To making a living, Bái owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. Bái has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1000000 VND a month from these activities. In 2009, Bái joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bái is requesting a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women for the first time. She is now requesting a new loan of 3000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Bái plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. N. Thị Dung (102) is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 3000000 VND loan to support her service-based business. 2. Vũ Thị Hoàn (104) is a 32 year-old female who is requesting a 3000000 VND loan to support her livestock business. 3. ảnTịnh Thị Gấm (103) is a 20 year-old female who is requesting a 3000000 VND loan to support her livestock business. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Bái N. Thị (101) là 65 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa. Bái là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 52 (052 Quảng Hưng). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Bái thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Bái kiếm được khoảng 1000000 VND. Vào 2009, Bái đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Bái đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. Thị Dung (102) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 2. Vũ Thị Hoàn (104) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. ảnTịnh Thị Gấm (103) là 20 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Monico

texts.en:
Monico M. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Manolo Fortich Bukidnon. He is 43 years old. Monico is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Monico owns and operates a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ready to wear items and used clothing to local community members. Monico is just starting this business.

In 2008, Monico joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Monico has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Monico is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Monico from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to grow the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Julleta

texts.en:
Julleta B. is from the village of Sto. Nino,  Manolo Fortich Bukidnon. She is 42 years-old and married and with eight grown-up children. To make a living, Julleta runs a specialized retail store which sells ready-to-wear items as well as used clothing in the local community. She has run her business for over a year, and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Julleta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julleta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new stock to expand. Julleta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Julleta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly G. is from the village of Sto.Nino , Manolo Fortich Bukidnon. She is 50 years-old and married and with one grown-up child. To make a living, Sherly runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Sherly has run the business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Sherly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase stock to expand her product range. Sherly is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Sherly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand and improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: 02.10.1.1 Group

texts.en:
Thanh N. Thị (10.0001) is 53 years old and lives in the town of Thanh Hóa. Thanh is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 10.1 Nam Ngạn (02.10.1.1).

Thanh is married and has 2 adult children. To making a living, Thanh owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling Pho (Vietnamese noodle soup) in the local community. Thanh has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities. In 2009, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thanh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.626.900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Thanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Đỗ Thị Lan (10.0004) is a 59 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her livestock business. 2. N. Thị Kiệm (10.0002) is a 49 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her livestock business. 3. Ngô Thị Tuyết (10.0005) is a 41 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her food stall. 4. N. Thị Cành (10.0003) is a 63 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her food stall. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Thanh N. Thị (10.0001) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa. Thanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 10.1 Nam Ngạn (02.10.1.1). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán Phở trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thanh kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2009, Thanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.626.900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Đỗ Thị Lan (10.0004) là 59 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. Thị Kiệm (10.0002) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Ngô Thị Tuyết (10.0005) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 4. N. Thị Cành (10.0003) là 63 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald B. is from the village of Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 28 years old, is single, and has two school-aged children. Ronald owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling bananas and firewood in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ronald joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita G. is from the village of Bucana, Sicayab. She is 63 years old. Pablita is widowed and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Pablita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Pablita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years with an approximate average monthly earnings of 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Pablita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pablita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Pablita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Pablita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Beti

texts.es: Beti tiene 34 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su familia y lo que más desea es tener una buena calidad de vida. Todas las noches, llegadas las 6 de la tarde, Beti sale junto a su carrito a vender sus deliciosas salchipapas (platillo hecho a base de papas y salchichas en rodajas, ambas fritas), tiene muchos clientes y sus salchipapas se venden muy rápido, ya que ofrece un precio más accesible a sus clientes, haciendo la diferencia con la competencia. Lo que más le gusta a Beti de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el frió que hace por las noches. Para el futuro espera tener una local de comida al paso donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad. Este es el segundo préstamo de Beti con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy responsable y siempre está pendiente de que se cumplan los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para hacer sus salchipapas, además comprara también más ollas y platos.

loans.use: Compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Mrs. Rita O. is a resident of Magsaysay, Sibutad, Z.N. She is married and blessed with 7 children. She is taking out a loan from Paglaum Coop in order to have additional capital for her existing business, which is fish vending. She has been active in the cooperative since she became a member, and according to her she is blessed to be part of this firm because of the sevices that Paglaum provides. She is hopeful that through this institution their way of living will improve.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her existing business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 55 años, es una madre D. familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Con mucho sacrificio y trabajo Juana logró instalar un taller D. confección D. zapatos, ella produce zapatos muy novedosos y llamativos, los cuales luego distribuye en las tiendas y puestos D. los mercados más importantes D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, sus productos son comprados muy rápido es por eso que las tiendas demandan mucho sus calzados. Lo que más le gusta a Juana D. su trabajo es confeccionar los zapatos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trasladar su mercadería hasta los lugares donD. los distribuye. Para el futuro anhela tener una tienda donD. pueda vender ella misma los zapatos que confecciona.
Este es el tercer préstamo D. Juana con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las demás socias D. su banco comunal, donD. es muy querida por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los novecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más materiales para elaborar más zapatos.

loans.use: Materiales para elaborar zapatos

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 38 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijas: Nataly de 15 y Francesca de 3 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En el colegio de ciencias “Alfred Nóbel” de la ciudad de Juliaca, Juana tiene su kiosco escolar, su negocio es muy concurrido por los alumnos, ya que siempre tiene cosas muy deliciosas que ofrecer, además de mucha paciencia para atender, motivo por el cual los profesores del colegio confían en ella. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite cuidar a su pequeña hija mientras trabaja, lleva 6 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder salir. Para el futuro espera reunir el dinero necesario para tener una tienda de abarrotes.
Este es el sétimo préstamo de Juana con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada, ya que siempre es muy puntual en sus reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su kiosco y así ofrecer a los alumnos y maestros una mayor variedad de productos.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería
