texts.en:
Jecinta is a small-scale farmer in Naivasha who plants potatoes on her small piece of land and sells them outside the door of her house to passers-by and her neighbors. She is a single mother of one child who attends schools.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to buy more potato seedlings to plant on her small farm and sell them later for a profit.

In the future, she plans to nurture her desire for farming by buying a bigger piece of land and plantting more potatoes. She also hopes that the farming business will pick up more and she will be selling her potatoes in large quantities and in other markets.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more potato seedlings

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna A. is from the village of Kabulawan in Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. Lorna is married. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store where she sells a variety of foods and daily-use products, such as shampoo, in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP that she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be Lorna's 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new items to sell

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Most residents of Naivasha must buy water from water vendors, because the town council cannot provide enough water for everyone. This is where Harrison thrives, because he has been seling water in the town for close to seven years, using his donkey to pull the cart loaded with water.

Harrison is 27 years old and married to Jane Muthoni. They have one school-going child.

He was intoduced to Kadet by his friend. He repaid his loan promptly and he used it to buy more tanks for storing water. He is now applying for his second loan. He plans to use the loan funds to buy another donkey and cart to help him meet the ever-rising needs of his clientele and to also reach more new clients. He will employ someone to help him distribute water around town with the new donkey and cart.

In future, he plans to buy a pickup truck, and open a new business transporting people and goods to and from the market.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy another cart and donkey to transport the water that he sells

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr: A. Albertine est née en 1969 à Allada dans le Département de l’Atlantique au Sud du Bénin. Albertine est mariée à LOKO Emmanuel, un instituteur. Albertine et son mari ont un enfant mais comme charge, ils ont deux enfants. La famille vit à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Albertine vend de façon ambulante des tissus, des chaussures et des vêtements.  Albertine a eu déjà deux crédits de ALIDé ; crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Pour mieux développer son activité, Albertine sollicite un troisième crédit d’ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de tissus, chaussures et vêtements.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph M. has been raising poultry to sell on a small scale for one year. He is 33 years old and still single.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend. He has already serviced two loans which he repaid promptly. He used the previous loan to build a shelter for his chicken-rearing project. He has now applied for a third loan to buy more chicks to raise and sell. He wants the chickens to be ready to sell during the festive season, because it is the peak time for his business.

In the future, he plans to supply poultry meat to hotels, not just around Naivasha, but also in major towns surrounding Naivasha like Nairobi and Nakuru.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more chicks which he will raise and sell

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: T. Yvette est née en 1971 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Yvette est mariée à AHOUANMENOU Antoine, un cuisinier. Le couple a quatre enfants dont trois sont encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Porto-Novo depuis quinze ans. Yvette et son mari assurent ensemble les dépenses de la famille. Yvette y arrive grâce au revenu de son activité. En effet, Yvette est dans la fabrication de savons. Yvette produit de savons qu’elle met sur le marché. Yvette a besoin de moyens financiers plus qu’elle n' en possède actuellement pour développer son activité. C’est la raison pour laquelle Yvette sollicite de prêt de la part d’ALIDé pour y arriver. Cependant, Yvette a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
T. Yvette was born in 1971 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of the Republic of Benin.  She is married to AHOUANMENOU Antoine, who is a cook.  The couple has four children, of whom three are still in their care.  The family has been living in Porto-Novo for fifteen years.  Yvette and her husband together ensure that family expenses are covered.  And she manages to do so, thanks to the revenues from her business.  Basically, she is in soap manufacturing.  She makes soap that she puts on the market.  Yvette has need of more financing than she currently has for developing her business.  For this reason, she's requesting a loan from ALIDé to achieve this.  However, she has already benefited from three ALIDé loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the raw matierals for making soaps:  oil, soda, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. is from the village of Owaon. She is 60 years old. Norma is widowed and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Norma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise including fertilizers. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta I., age 49, and her family, migrated to Manila from Cagayan Valley a couple of years ago. Two of her five children are now working, another two are in college, and the youngest is not yet of school age. Her husband Odon Monto, 49, is a security guard.

Violeta has already adjusted very well to city life. Getting into business in Manila was not hard for her, considering that she has been running a business for the last twenty years. "Business is in her blood," she says. Her general store is continuously growing. She recently started selling purified drinking water in large plastic containers. She earns P30, 000.00 in net monthly income. Her children's education is Violeta's priority when budgeting her income.

She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. The loans provided by the cooperative are easy to pay. Because of their low interest rates, she was able to finish repaying her loans without knowing it. She has applied for a new loan of P22,000.00 to use as additional capital for her general store.

Violeta dreams of owning a new house and lot for her family.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. 

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta B. is 55 years old. She has been buying and selling bananas for ten years. She lives in Area-B, Parola, Binondo, Manila, very close to an international container terminal and seaport. Her husband is a driver.

Marietta supplies bananas in bulk to retailers in a public market in Sampaloc, Manila. She earns a net income of P24,000.00 a month from this business. 

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 1998. She is one of CCT's earliest community members. She has just finished repaying her previous loan from the cooperative. She has applied for a new loan of P34,000.00 to as additional capital for her banana dealership.

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. 

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

She applied for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc.  She needs the loan to buy farm supplies and to pay for the hand tractor she uses. This will help her to sustain her business.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr: B. Lucie est née le 13 Décembre 1979 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Mariée à HOUNGBEDJI Paul, un carreleur, Lucie vit à Porto-Novo depuis quinze ans. En plus de ses deux enfants, Lucie a en charge deux autres enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les dépenses de la famille. Lucie vend à manger du riz et du haricot à côté de son domicile. Lucie s’approvisionne au marché de Ouando situé à Porto-Novo au Bénin. Lucie a bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédits qu’elle a eu à bien rembourser. Lucie ambitionne augmenter son fonds de roulement et accroitre sa clientèle. C’est ce qui l’a conduit à solliciter à nouveau un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Lucie B. was born on December 13th, 1979 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to Paul Houngbedji, a tile layer; and has been living in Porto-Novo for fifteen years. In addition to her own two children, Lucie is also taking care of two other children, all of which are schooled. The couple takes care of family expenses together. Lucie sells rice and beans beside her house. Lucie buys her inventory at the Ouando market, located in Porto-Novo, Benin. Lucie has already benefited from two previous loans that she repaid in full. Lucie's aims to increase her working capital and her customer base, which is why she is requesting her third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, oil and sauce ingredients (tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc.)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.en:
Maria Luisa E. runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 54 years old, married and has three adult children. She is from the village of Upper Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. Maria Luisa is just starting her business.

In 2009, Maria Luisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Médégnonmi Similienne

texts.fr: A. Médégnonmi Similienne est née le 22 Mai 1973 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Médégnonmi Similienne vit depuis 30 ans à Porto-Novo et est mariée à AHOUNOU Elie, un mécanicien auto. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Médégnonmi Similienne vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Médégnonmi Similienne vend depuis 20 ans du pain accompagné de sandwich à la gare de Pobè, non loin de Porto-Novo. Médégnonmi Similienne s’approvisionne à la boulangerie Paterson à Porto-Novo et à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Médégnonmi Similienne a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé. Dans l’optique d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et sa clientèle, Médégnonmi Similienne sollicite à nouveau un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de sardine, mayonnaise, beurre, huile et condiments (tomates, oignons, piments, etc.)

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen T. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 27 years old and single. Ailen is just starting this business. She is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental.

In 2009, Ailen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ailen is requesting a loan of 4,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Noélie Talomonho

texts.fr: A. Noélie Talomonho est née en 1963 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Noélie Talomonho est mariée à VIATONOU Claude et vit depuis 26 ans à Sadognon, un quartier de Porto-Novo. Le couple a cinq enfants avec un enfant à charge. Noélie Talomonho vit seule avec ses enfants, mais les deux conjoints supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Noélie Talomonho vend depuis près de 30 ans des tissus, des chaussures, des glacières et des bijoux de façon ambulante. Noélie Talomonho achète ces produits à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Noélie Talomonho a bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Pour augmenter le volume de son activité et capitaliser assez d’économie, Noélie Talomonho sollicite à nouveau un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Noélie Talomonho A. was born in 1963 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Noélie Talomonho is married to Claude Viatonou, and has been living in Sadognon, a district of Porto-Novo, for 26 years. The couple has 5 children of their own, as well as one dependent child in their care. Noélie Talomonho lives alone with her children, but both spouses take care of family expenses together. For almost 30 years Noélie Talomonho has been selling fabrics, shoes, coolers and jewelry in an ambulatory fashion. Noélie Talomonho buys her products in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Noélie Talomonho has already benefited from two past loans that she repaid in full. To increase her sales volume and to improve her savings, Noélie Talomonho is now requesting a third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics, shoes and jewelry

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn T. is from the village of Jasaan , Misamis Oriental. She is 41-years-old. Jonalyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jonalyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Jonalyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jonalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jonalyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jonalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase young livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Kevwe

texts.en: Kevwe lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and baking materials. she is married with 6 children and she is 41 years old. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provisions and baking materials to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and baking materials to sell

loans.name: Bat-Ulzii

texts.en: Bat-Ulzii is 37 years old and lives with his wife and son in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son attends a secondary school, and his wife helps her husband with his business. Bat-Ulzii operates a used furniture trading business where he refurbishes old furnishings and sells them. He started his business in 2000, and, today, his working capital exceeds 2,000,000 MNT (approximately 1400 USD). Korean imports of used furniture are increasing daily, and Bat-Ulzii’s number of customers is increasing as well. Bat-Ulzii would like to keep growing his business, eventually owning his own furniture factory one day. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more used furniture that he can refurbish and sell.

loans.use: To purchase more used furniture to refurbish and sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella S. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Estrella owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling personal care products and at the same time cellphone electronic loading to the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Estrella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a young, single man who he lives in the city of Bethlehem. He didn't finish his university course because he began work as a taxi driver to help his mother and young brothers and sisters. The family economic status is very bad and Hasan has to work very hard to help his young brothers and sisters finish school. His work is the only source of income.

Hasan needs the loan to pay for insurance and registration fees in addition to doing some maintenance on his the car. He appears in the photo beside his taxi.

loans.use: To pay for taxi registration, insurance fees and maintenance

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chandra Mae

texts.en:
Chandra Mae D., 24, is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental, where she is married and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop that sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Chandra Mae has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, she joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chandra Mae is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, her first, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Voa Tiger Group

texts.en:
Christiana A. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called VOA Tiger. She is 45 years old and an elementary school drop-out due to poverty. Christiana is married with three children aged 14-28 years old and their educational levels are 9th high school graduate. She also cares for three siblings.

Christiana lives and does business in the Jah Tono community, Brewerville area, north of the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.
This community is known as a very old settlement where people settle after leaving the rural areas; it is also known as a community where people fight poverty to change their lives.

Christiana's business is purchasing food ingredients like seasonings, pepper, oil, fresh tomatoes, onions, etc. She buys wholesale and sells to the residents of Jah Tono. She has been running this business for three years and is hoping to improve her business to a better standard. She sells at affordable prices that encourage customers to always want to patronize her business. Her main challenge is when she sells on credit. But if she doesn't give credit, she feels it drives them away, although she is able to save.

Christiana needs this loan to purchase bags of charcoal as a method of expanding her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education to enable them to become prominent people in society.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal to expand her business

loans.name: Chuluundorj

texts.en: Chuluundorj is a 24 year old single man who lives in his own home in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He operates a jeans retail trading business in a rented stall in the largest out-door market, Narantuul in the city. He started his business in 2005 with working capital of 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) and a daily profit between 30,000 and 50,000 tugrug (~21-35 USD). Chuluundorj wants to expand his business and save enough money so that he can get married and start a family. He is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug (~2460 USD) to purchase more varieties of jeans so that he can attract new customers.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of jeans

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn R. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Merlyn owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits for sale, especially bananas. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs and has requested a loan for N50,000 to purchase more stock. She would like to thank all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan D. S. is a 54-year-old businesswoman who lives in Pasay City with her two children, the eldest of whom is in college and the other is in high school. Susan loves to multi-task in her business activities. She manages her own general store and at the same time manages an adjacent extension of their house as an apartment for rent. She earns close to P15,000 a month from these business endeavors. She uses her profits to support their daily basic needs including school expenses for her children. Susan got to know about the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative and eventually became a member in 2003 after attending a series of teach-ins conducted by a field staff. The loans provided by the cooperative are helpful in the continuous growth of her general store. Susan is applying for a new loan in the amount of P22,000 from the cooperative. She will use the funds to buy more grocery items to sell at her store. A portion of the loan proceeds will be used to renovate some rooms in her apartment. Susan dreams of seeing her children finish their college education. She said that education is the only gift she can leave her children. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her store and to renovate her rental apartment

loans.name: Raymark

texts.en: Raymark Z. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. He is 38 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Raymark owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas for sale. He is just starting this business. In 2009, Raymark joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Mariée, mère de 5 enfants, Madame Awa C. a 45 ans et vit  avec son époux et ses enfants  dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).  
N’ayant pas eu la chance de continuer les études, Madame Awa n’a pas pris du temps à s’accrocher aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa maman depuis son jeune âge et l’exerce pour elle-même il y a 20 ans de cela. Son activité principale est la vente des  chaussures et autres articles divers. En plus du commerce, elle fait de la prestation de services, car elle est coiffeuse également, une activité qui lui est très rentable, elle est très bien sollicitée par  bon nombres de  femmes de la ville de Koutiala. 
En vu d’augmenter son fonds de commerce  et satisfaire sa clientèle en qualité, elle a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel.  
Avec ce financement elle compte acheter,  40 paires de chaussures  et 10 sacs. Elle s’approvisionne à  Bamako  et effectue sa vente en ville de Koutiala à une clientèle composée  de jeunes filles et de femmes mariées,  au comptant ou a crédit.  
Avec l’augmentation de son chiffre d’affaire , elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA  qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire ses besoins, entretenir ses enfants  et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat de chaussures et sacs.

loans.name: Gift

texts.en:
Gift is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs in retail to her customers. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to pull her business above poverty.

She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1969 à Koutiala, Madame Fatoumata Fané  est mariée mère de 8 enfants et   vit avec son époux et ses  enfants dans le quartier  Koko  de la préfecture  de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Dû à des raisons sociales, Fatoumata a prématurément abandonné les études  pour s’intéresser  aux activités génératrices de revenus  auprès de sa maman  commerçante import  export depuis son enfance. La  vente de tissus et chaussures   son ses activités principales, elle l’exerce depuis  15 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne car elle ravitaille beaucoup de petits détaillants au grand marché de Koutiala.  
Dans le souci d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et satisfaire sa clientèle en quantité et en qualité, elle n’a pas pris du temps pour faire recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso. Après une année de collaboration,  elle est à son 2ème  prêt individuel, le précédent a été correctement payé sans difficulté.  
Avec ce financement elle compte acheter, 50 paires de chaussures et 10 pièces de tissus wax au Nigeria . Elle effectue sa vente au grand  marché de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant ou à crédit.  
Avec l’augmentation de son chiffre d’affaire, elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA  qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso,  participer aux  dépenses quotidiennes  de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat de  tissus et chaussures.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites A. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Marites owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Marites is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Âgé de  38 ans, Zoumana Koné est marié à deux  épouses, père de 2 enfants, il vit dans une famille  polygame dans l’un des quartiers populaire de Koutiala Sogomougou  ( Région de Sikasso ).  
Du à des raisons sociales, il n’a pas eu la chance d’être instruit  raison pour laquelle il s’est accroché aux activités  génératrices de revenus  depuis son jeune âge, qu’il apprit  auprès de son feu père jadis commerçant. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenus et sa notoriété dépasse les limites de la seule ville de Koutiala.  
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’élargissement de son activité,  Monsieur  Zoumana  a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  il y a 2 ans.  IL est à son  troisième prêt individuel, après avoir correctement remboursés les précédents.  
Ce prêt servira a acquérir divers stocks de marchandises. Il s’approvisionne au près  des grossistes  de Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique au quartier Sogomougou de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et hommes au comptant., en détail et à crédit.  
Avec l’élargissement de son activité, Monsieur compte réaliser un  bénéfice de 150 000 FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts, prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité. IL envisage rembourser ce prêt correctement pour qu’il puisse bénéficier un autre dans le but d’élargir son activité.

loans.use: Achat de diverses marchandises.

loans.name: My Children Business Group

texts.en:
Ruth L. B. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called My Children Business. She is 34 years old and a college student. Ruth is a single mother of three children aged 12-18 years old and their educational levels are 9th grade to 1st year university. She also cares for four siblings. She lives at and sells on the VOA Road, Brewerville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Ruth's business is food preparation and she sells to the residents of VOA Road. She has been running this business for four years and is grateful to the business for taking care of herself and her children. Ruth's difficulty she faces with her business is when her business money gets stolen.

Preparing her food is the best way that Ruth attracts her customers. She needs this loan in order to purchase more food and ingredients to grow her business. Becoming an international businesswoman is Ruth's dream, so as to give herself and her children a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more food and ingredients to grow her business

loans.name: Ochuko

texts.en:
Ochuko is 46 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells provisions like sugar, noodles, milk, etc. She is a hard working woman. She opens her shop daily.

She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en: Desideria A. is from the village of Sta. Filomena. She is 52 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Desideria owns and operates a business providing multi-cab passenger services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Desideria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Desideria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in a new business such as selling ground meat known as "logganisa". This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in another business such as selling longganisa

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth A., 39 years old, lives in the populous urban community of Maricaban, Pasay City. She has three children: two attend high school and the youngest is in grade school. Her husband, Ramoncito, 49, is a transport supervisor. Maribeth has owned a general store for thirteen years. Business has been very progressive through the years and she has already been able to purchase two passenger jeepneys (small buses). She is now earning P12,000 a month. She uses her profits to sustain the education of her children. Maribeth has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2003. She is now applying for a new loan of P22,000 which she will use to purchase an upright freezer for her general store. She will also stock up on soft drinks. Maribeth wishes to have another branch in the adjacent village. She also wants to see all her children finish their college education. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase an upright freezer and softdrinks

Eva B. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Eva is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns & operates a service-based business. Eva has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. loans.name: Litas

Litas E. is from the village of Obay. She is 44 years old. Litas is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Litas owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Litas has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda P., 52 years old, has been repacking spices in her home for more than a decade now. She lives in Maricaban, Pasay City. Her husband Roberto, 55, is a carpenter. They have three children; one is now working his way towards overseas employment. Hilda repacks spices like black pepper, dried laurel leaves, and garlic in small plastic bags and distributes them to store owners for retail. She also repacks stuff like dye, chlorine powder, and sodium crystals. She earns 3,000 PHP a month. She has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2001. She is now on her 9th loan cycle. Hilda applied for a new loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP to buy raw materials for her business. Hilda's dream is for her children to finish their college education. About CCT: The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical missions in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To puchase raw materials for her repacking business

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: This is Corazon O., 33 years old. She lives among the poor communities of Maricaban, Pasay City. Her husband, Noel, 42, drives a pedicab (rickshaw) for a living. They have three children: the eldest is in college and the other two are both in high school. Corazon has managed her own general store for six years now. As an additional source of income, she recently added a burger stand and is earning a net income of P5,000 a month. She uses her profits to augment her husband’s income in addressing their needs for daily necessities, especially their children’s education. Corazon has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2003. She needs a loan of P9,000 as additional capital for her burger business. She wants to concentrate on this business because of consistent demand from customers. Corazon dreams of seeing her children finish their college education. She has also been dreaming of owning their own house and lot. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: New Establishment Group

texts.en:
New Establishment is a group of five borrowers led by Izetta S., 44, who is a 9th grade drop-out due to lack of support. She is married with three children, ages 22-25 years old. Izetta lives in Perry town community. It is north of Monrovia, Liberia, and it is a very crowded and poor community that got shattered by the civil war.

Izetta's business is food preparation and sales.She buys food ingredients and prepares them for sale to the residents of Perry town, Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for 15 years and is doing well.

During the rainy season she lost customers because she didn't have a good shelter for her business; therefore, she needs this loan in order to purchase more bags of rice and some fufu (local Liberian dish), and to repair her little shop so that if the rain starts to come, her customers can eat with comfort.

Izetta's food is well prepared in order to attract more customers. Her dream is to expand her business to owning a bigger shop and giving her children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase rice and fufu (local Liberian dish), and to repair her shop from rain damage

Charmalou has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

loans.name: Prosperity Enterprise Group

texts.en:
Prosperity Enterprise is a group of five borrowers led by Annie W., who is 28 years old and married with three children ages 1-10 years old. Her eldest child's education level is second grade. Annie is a 9th grade drop-out because of lack of support; she couldn’t go further in education but rather, she had to get married and started having children. She lives in the Brewer Ville community. It is north of Monrovia, Liberia, and it is an isolated and poor community that got destroyed by the civil war.

Annie's business is selling food ingredients, like beans, rice, oil, wheat, etc. She buys wholesale and sells at retail to the residents of Brewer Ville, Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for more than two years. She started with a very small amount but now runs a little shop. Annie sells in a neat place and also does delivery to homes as a method of getting more customers.

Getting beans and wheat is very difficult on the Liberian market because farms have been destroyed by the civil crisis. Annie needs this loan to purchase bags of beans and tins of palm oil. She dreams of improving her business so as to complete her dream by educating her children for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase bags of beans and tins of palm oil for resale

texts.en:
Pacencia M. is a 41-year-old entrepreneur living in Silang, Cavite. Her husband, Jose, 45, works for a construction firm. They have three children; the eldest is in high school and the two others are in grade school.

Pacencia owns and manages a general store, which she started two years ago. She is now earning at least 2,800 PHP a month despite stiff competition amongst neighboring stores. She uses her profits to help provide daily basic needs of the family, especially her children’s education.  

She came to know and became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2008.  She is now on her third loan cycle. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP to be able to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store.

Just like everybody else, it’s been her desire to graduate from poverty and she sees education as the best tool to equip her children. That is why she works hard to support their schooling.
   
About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Good Will Outreach Group

texts.en:
Good Will Outreach is a group of five borrowers led by A.B Joseph C., a 40-year-old college graduate who is married with children ages 9-15 years old. His children's educational levels are from 2nd to 8th grade. He also cares for one sibling.

He lives and works in the Brewer V. community, north of the capital of Monrovia, Liberia. It is a community that is mixed with both poor and middle class Liberians, but the rate of poverty is high.

A.B Joseph's business is agricultural activities. He grows different kinds of plants for consumption, like cabbage, potatoes, lettuce, cassava leaves, etc., which he sells to the residents of Brewer V., northern Monrovia, Liberia. He started this business six years ago. When he graduated from university, he decided to get into agriculture. Since Joseph got into agriculture, that has been the means of taking care of his family. The way Joseph speaks and interacts with his customers makes them always want to buy from him. 

He needs this loan in order to purchase agricultural materials like fertilizer, seeds of different kinds, a digger and a shovel in order to improve his business. His dream is to have a big farm with which he can serve at least Monrovia, and to educate his children for their future to come.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds, and farming tools

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru: Икром Саидкулов проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 25 лет. Холост, детей не имеет. Икром имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует хозяйственными товарами уже более 3 лет. Икром просит кредит для закупа стройматериалов, т.е. гвоздей, стеклорезов и т.д.

loans.use: Пополнение оборотных средств

loans.name: Melling

texts.en:
Melling J. is currently in the business of selling maize and sorghum and is requesting a loan to purchase more sorghum to sell. Melling is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has four children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land, build and rent it out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more maize and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.pt:
Ana Maria nasceu na cidade central da Beira, província de Sofala, tem 35 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 2 e 16 anos. Os dois mais velhos estudam nas escolas publicas de boane. Concluiu o nível médio de Agronomia. Vive na casa própria com sua família (marido, filhos e um sobrinho).

Saiu de Sofala quando tinha 7 anos de idade juntamente com a sua família para cidade de Inhambane (província a 400 km a norte de Maputo) onde estudou ate 10 classe. Foi à razão que lhe valeu a transferência para boane a fim de continuar com os estudos no instituto de Agronomia. Mais tarde casou se e passou a viver definitivamente no distrito. O seu marido trabalha para uma empresa de instalações elétricas como eletricista. Ana Maria já tem 12 anos de experiência como docente na escola Primaria da vila de Boane, perto da sua residência, e recebe 6.000,00mt que aplica no sustento da familia.

Já teve empréstimos com o banco Procredito para iniciar com as obras de construção da sua casa e tendo reembolsado sem problemas. Através das amigas colegas que deram as informações comparativas entre a Hluvuku-Adsema e outras instituições concorrentes, preferiram aproximar e solicita 20.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, tijoleiras e louca de casa de banho).

Propõe se pagar o empréstimo sem problema para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com intuito de concluir a casa. A casa ainda de tijoleiras para o chão, pintura, acabamentos na cozinha e mais intervenções.
texts.en:
Ana Maria was born in the town of Beira, Sofala province, in Mozambique. She is 35, married and the mother of 3 children between 2 and 16 years old. The two older ones attend public school in Boane. Ana Maria went to school for Agronomy. She lives in her own house with her family (husband, children and a nephew). She left Sofala when she was 7 with her parents to the city of Inhambane (400km north of Maputo), where she finished 10th grade. She later moved to Boane to continue her studies at the Institute of Agronomy. She later got married and set residence in Boane. Her husband works as an electrician at a local company. Ana Maria has 12 years of experience teaching at the Boane primary school, and she makes 6.000,00MT (about U$220) per month, which is used to support her family. She has made loans with the Procredito bank before, in order to build her house, and paid them back without a problem. She is now asking for 20.000,00MT (U$725) to buy construction supplies (cement, bricks and bathroom tiles). She plans on paying the loan quickly so she can ask for other loans in order to finish her house, which still needs floor tiles, painting, and kitchen finishing, between other minor details.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, bricks, tiles)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase working capital

She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.name: Quiza Samuel

texts.pt:
Quiza Samuel nasceu na província nortenha de Cabo delgado (a 3.500km de maputo, na fronteira com a Republica da Tanzânia, tem 53 anos de idade, casado e pai de sete filhos com idades compreendidas entre 13 e 35 anos). Estudou ate 12 classe tendo parado para formar a família. Vive no distrito Boane na casa própria. Os 3 filhos mais velhos já estão casados e vivem com as famílias constituídas.

Viveu muito tempo fora do pais (Tanzânia, Congo DRC e outros da áfrica central) é filho de pais políticos que trabalhavam nesses paises. Foi na Tanzânia que o quiza aprendeu a fazer negócios, como estratégia de sobrevivência quando perdeu seus progenitores.
No ano de 2002 foi repatriado e preferiu instalar se no distrito de boane juntamente com a sua família. 
Tem um estaleiro de venda de materiais de construção (cimento, ferro, pedra e outros) e obtém uma receita diária de aprox. 3.000,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e no crescimento do próprio negocio. Para alem desta actividade faz também avicultura (criação de frangos de corte)

Este vai ser o seu quarto empréstimo no valor de 26.000,00MT para compra de material de construção de mais um estabelecimento comercial (mine mercearia) e para tal precisa adquirir cimento, areia pedra, chapas de zinco e outros materiais. Tem como objectivo diversificar o negocio para ganhar mais dinheiro.
Os outros empréstimos foram para compra e venda de materiais de construção (13.000,00MT; 18.000,00MT e 15.000,00MT, este ultimo para agropecuária).

Propõe se a pagar bem o credito para poder a ceder a mais empréstimos com objectivos de concluir a mercearia e reforçar as actividades existentes.
texts.en:
Quiza Samuel was born in the northern province of Cabo Delgado (3,500km from Maputo, in the border with Tanzania). He is 53, married and the father of seven children with ages between 13 and 35. He finished 12th grade and had to drop school to support his family. He lives in Boane and owns his house. His three oldest children are married and live with their families. Quiza lived in other countries for a long time (Tanzania, Congo and other places in Central Africa), as his parents were politicians and worked in different countries. It was in Tanzania that Quiza learned how to do business, as a survival strategy after his parents passed away. In 2002 he was repatriated and decided to set residence in Boane with his family. He has a shop where he sells construction supplies (cement, iron, rocks and others) and he makes about 3.000,00MT (about U$ 110) per day, which he uses to support his family and improve his business. Besides running the store, he also raises chicken for a living. This is going to be his 4th loan, in the amount of 26.000,00MT (U$ 950) to buy construction materials to build a convenience store. His objective is to diversify his businesses to make more money. The other three loans were used to buy construction supplies and chicken. He plans on paying the loan quickly so he can apply for other loans in order to finish building his new convenience store and improve the business he already has.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction supplies

loans.name: Oluwaloju

texts.en: Oluwaloju is 44 years old and she is married with 4 children. She has been selling drinks and snacks since the past 4 years. She hawks her goods within her community.She hopes for the loan amount of N170,000 to purchase more drinks and snacks to sell.she says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and snacks to sell

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Абдуллоева Саодат проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 39 лет. Разведена, имеет 4 детей. Сама Саодат более 3 лет занимается торговлей у себя дома. Она занимается покупкой б/у товаров и их перепродажей. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента. С полученной прибыли Саодат хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Saodat A. lives in the Shahrituz region. She is divorced and has four children. Saodat has been doing retail at her home for more than three years. She buys used goods and then resells them. She is asking for a loan to buy a new batch. Saodat will use the profit to repair her home.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a batch of inventory

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva M. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Primitiva is married and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Primitiva owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Primitiva has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Primitiva joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Primitiva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Primitiva is requesting a new loan of 14500 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Primitiva from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rasse

texts.pt:
Rasse nasceu no distrito municipal da caT. (a sul da baia de Maputo), tem 56 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos quatros dos quais maiores idade e a ultima de 12 anos freqüenta escola na vila de boane. Rasse não teve oportunidade de freqüentar escola devido ao mito de que ˝ escola é para somente rapazes˝. Vive na casa própria com mais um sobrinha e dois sobrinhos órfãos de pais. 

Rasse é filha de pais camponeses e saiu da caT. para boane em 1969 logo após o casamento tradicional (lobolo) e passou a viver na vila de boane. É comerciante (vende hortícolas e cereais) desde o ano de 1970 e trabalha sem empregados. O seu marido é também camponês (sem emprego formal nem reforma) e ajuda a esposa na actividade, às vezes. Rende por mês aprox. 5.200,00mt que aplica no sustento da família.

 Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições e este é o seu quarto crédito no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra e venda de hortícolas e cereais na vila de boane em frente ao mercado do conselho executivo local.

Os primeiros três créditos de (10.000,00MT; 15.000,00MT 20.000,00MT) foram para a mesma actividade e tendo pagado sem problemas. Acha que vai melhorar o nível de rendimento familiar e futuramente tenciona construir uma mine loja de material convencional, para tal conta com mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Rasse was born in the district of CaT. (south of the Maputo bay). She is 56 years old, married and the mother of five children, four of them adults and a 12 year old girl who attends school in Boane. Rasse didn't have the chance to study, because back in her day there was a myth that "school is for boys only". She lives in her own house with her children, a niece and two nephews who are orphans. Rasse's parents were farmers and she left CaT. for Boane in 1969 after an arranged marriage, a traditional costume in some African countries. She sells vegetables and cereals for a living since 1970, and has no other employees. Her husband is also a farmer, though without a formal job, and helps her with her business from time to time. She makes around 5.200,00MT (U$173) per month, money that she uses to support her family. This is Rasse's 4th loan and she's asking for 20.000,00MT (U$ 725), money that she'll use to buy vegetables and cereals and sell in the farmers market in Boane. She thinks she can improve her household's income by improving her business, and has plans to open her own store in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables and cereals

loans.name: Nero Jose

texts.en:
Nero Jose V. is from the village of Taguima, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 37 years old. Nero Jose is married and has one child who attends school. To make a living, Nero Jose owns and operates a general store, where he sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Nero Jose has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Nero Jose joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nero Jose is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nero Jose from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Avelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Avelina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Avelina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

texts.ru: Ли Флора проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 61 год. Замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Ли более 15 лет занимается продажей корейских салатов на рынке, где имеет торговую точку. texts.en:

L. has been selling Korean salads on the market where she has a vendor space for more than fifteen years. L.'s profession is an economist. She is asking for a loan to buy products to prepare the salads. She will use the profit she makes to repair her home.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for salads

loans.name: Angelica

texts.pt:
Angélica nasceu na cidade da M. (a 17 km da vila de Boane em direção a cidade de maputo), tem 49 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de seis filhos dos quais três frequentam escola. Estudou ate 3 classe devido falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores. Vive na casa própria já sem marido a mais de 5 anos. Para alem dos filhos sustenta também mais dois irmãos que vivem no mesmo espaço físico sob sua responsabilidade.

Saiu da cidade da M. juntamente com a sua família, seu pai trabalhava na empresa de águas de Maputo na estação de captação de boane. Casou se quanto tinha cerca de 20 anos de idade com o já falecido marido. Seus pais também faleceram há bastante tempo e sobrevive vendendo produtos de primeira necessidade (vende cereais, produtos de higiene e beleza e outros comestíveis). Rende aprox. 4.000,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e poupa um pouco no esquema informal de poupança rotativa (xitique).
Este é o seu quarto empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de materiais de construção (cimento, tintas e outros). Os outros créditos de 25.000,00MT; 11.000,00MT para habitação e 15.000,00MT para serviços e tendo reembolsado sem problemas.

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para aceder a mais créditos para apetrechar a casa e diversificar o negocio.
texts.en:
Angélica was born in M. (17km from Boane) in Mozambique. She is a 49 year old widow with six children, four of them students. She finished 3rd grade but had to drop school because of her parent's financial difficulties. She got married when she was 20 and her husband passed away 5 years ago, leaving her to take care of all the children plus two of her brothers that live in her house. Her parents have also passed away years ago and she supports her family by selling basic food and cleaning products. She makes around 4.000,00MT (U$138) per month, and with that money she's able to support her family and save a little bit every month. This is her 4th loan and she's asking for 15.000,00MT (U$550) to buy construction supplies (cement, paint and others). She plans on paying the loan without a problem so she can take more loans and finish building her house, as well as improve her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction supplies (cement, paint, and others)

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia Cañon, a 48-year old single parent, has been working hard on her hog raising business. She lives with her two sons; the eldest is already working and the other one is enrolled in college. Both help her with home chores when there’s no work and classes.

Alicia is raising pigs to get income to support her and the children, especially their education. She has been both mother and father to them since she and her husband parted ways years ago for domestic reasons she opted to keep to herself. Life was hard for her then, but she was able to cope and move on thanks to her faith in the Almighty. She found consolation in getting into business. She also sells fresh pork meat. She brings her pigs to the butcher when they are ready for slaughtering. Alicia also cooks meals and sells them to customers. She earns more than 45,000 PHP a month from these business activities.

She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005. She applied for a new loan with the cooperative in the amount of 20,000 PHP to have available funds for the renovation of her pig pen. She would like to extend her pen because her pigs are now crammed inside it. She only used to have six pigs. Now, she already has nine mother pigs and many growing baby pigs.

Alicia hopes to acquire a farm lot where she can build a bigger pig farm complex. She also wishes to build an apartment. She dreams to see her sons living happily with their own families. She is very thankful to the Almighty for giving her two loving sons. She considers them as gift from heaven.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene R., who is 47 years old. She lives in Pasay City. Her husband, Nelson, 45, is a house painter. They have three children.

Arlene is a multi-tasking businesswoman. She has a general store in front of her house. She also sells frozen meat products. She also converted a few rooms in her house as apartments for rent. She earns nearly 25,000 PHP a month from these business activities. Her profits are used to support her family’s daily needs. She is also sending her grandchildren to school.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2004.  Having been a member has brought her many blessings.  Through the loans from the cooperative and combined with her savings from her profits, she acquired a residential lot which is now continuously amortizing. Her next project would be to build a house for her family and leave their current house for rent. Arlene applied for a new loan from the Cooperative in the amount of 18,000 PHP.  She will use the funds to renovate her apartment.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.name: Norietta

texts.en:
This is Norietta A.. She is 44 years old and lives in a shanty village in the heart of Parola Compound, Tondo, Manila. She and her husband Pio, who is 50 and makes a living as a driver, have four children.

Norietta runs a general merchandise store in the Harbour Center at Manila's International Container Terminal, a seaport.  She sells accessories and ready-to-wear clothing as well as cosmetics, shoes and apparel. She earns an income of P8,000 a month from her work and uses most of that money to educate her children.

Norietta is a pioneer member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in Intramuros. She joined the cooperative in 1998 and been active in all of its programs and activities. She is now on her 18th loan, for P17,000, which she will use to expand her businesses.

Norietta dreams of having her own store so she won’t need to pay a monthly fee to the vendors’ association where she leases her small shop.


About CCT

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely L. is 56 years old and has made a living running a small canteen for the last five years. She lives in Parola, Binondo, Manila with her husband Antonio, 55, who is a porter at a nearby seaport. They have eight children, three of whom are still in school.

Mely's canteen is located on the ground floor of a commercial building in Binondo, Manila’s Chinatown. She employs four assistants who help her cook food and serve it to customers. Her monthly income is about P65,000.

She has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2004.  She has just finished repaying a loan from this organization, and has applied for a new one for P8 000, which she will use to continue running her business.

Mely dreams of establishing another branch of her canteen on the other side of Chinatown. She is training her children in how to run a business, so that when they become adults they already have a hands-on knowledge of the basics of management.

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
Novie E. lives in Baseco Compound, Port Area, Manila.  She is 53 years old and lives with her husband Lindro, 52, who makes a living driving a motorcycle. They have three children.

Novie runs a general store located in front of their house. She also buys and sells frozen meat products, earning close to P15,000 per month, just enough to make ends meet. 

She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2004. Novie just repaid her seventh loan from the cooperative, and is applying for a new one for P16,000 to use as additional capital for her general store. She also intends to use it to buy and sell rice.

Novie’s dream is to become a franchiser for a popular brand of frozen meat products so she can get inventories directly from its plant at a lower price.

loans.name: Liria

texts.es:
Liria es una persona alegre y muy colaboradora, tiene 62 años D. edad, es madre D. cinco hijos mayores D. edad, ella vive con una D. sus hijas, se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. segundo uso y también venD. productos D. belleza, para ello cuenta con el apoyo D. su hija, viajan por diferente caseríos ofreciendo su mercadería, es socia del Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza” desD. hace cinco años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue D. 300 soles que invirtió en la compra D. productos D. belleza.

Ahora requiere un préstamo D. 2000 soles que le permitirá invertir en la compra D. ropa D. segundo uso, pues le envían D. la ciudad D. Lima. La meta D. Liria es tener un depósito para dar el servicio D. guardianía D. vehículos, ya que cuenta con un terreno granD., para ello necesita hacer un cerco D. ladrillos que lo esta haciendo poco a poco a fin D. ofrecer mayor seguridad.

loans.use: Invertirá en la compra de ropa de segundo uso

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: Ada Luz es una mujer trabajadora y colaboradora de 29 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, se dedica a la crianza de pollos junto a su esposo, pues tienen tres galpones que están ubicados en la carretera Federico Basadre (fuera del centro de la ciudad), estos pollos luego los vende en el mercado de Bellavista , es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Marko Jara” desde hace dos años ,el primer préstamo que recibió le permitió invertir en alimentos balanceados para pollos.  COn este préstamo de 1000 soles, piensa invertirlo en alimentos balanceados para los pollos. La meta de Ada es poder tener un molino para que pueda elaborar sus propios alimentos para la crianza de pollos.

loans.use: invertirá en alimentos balanceados para  pollos (aves de corral)

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra es una mujer jovial y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 22 años y es madre de una pequeña de un añito, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, paralelamente vende ropa de segundo uso, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es chofer de motocarro(propio). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth” desde hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que invirtió en gaseosas, ahora necesita un crédito de 1200 que será utilizado para invertir en golosinas. La meta de Mayra es tener una tienda de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Mayra is a cheerful and hardworking woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the province of Coronel Portillo. She is 22 years old and the mother of a one-year-old daughter. She has a business selling snacks, and she also sells used clothing. She enjoys full support from her husband, who works as a driver with his own car. She has been a member of the "Jesus of Nazareth" Communal Bank for four years. The first loan she received was for 300 Peruvian soles, and she invested it in soft drinks. Currently, she needs a loan of 1200 soles, which will be invested in snacks for her business. Mayra's goal for the future is to open a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in snacks for her business

loans.name: Dolibet

texts.es: Dolibet es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa provincia D. Coronel Portillo, tiene 57 años y es madre D. cuatro hijos, D. los cuales tres son mayores D. edad y uno menor, se dedica a la elaboración D. dulces como suspiros, bizcochuelos, kekes, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que es trabajador independiente. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas II” desD. hace cuatro años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue D. 300 soles, que invirtió en insumos para sus dulces, ahora necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles que será invertido una parte en quesos y otra parte en insumos para sus dulces.
