La Alcancia Comunal  "EMPRENDEDORES D. SICUANI" está representado por la Sra. Miguela C.  y conformados por 11 miembros los cuales cursan el quinto ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, unión, honestidad y sobre todo ganas D. salir adelante. 
La Sra. Miguela C. se dedica al rubro textil hace muchos años, negocio que le permite brindar educación  a sus 4 hijos. 
La tesorera Elizabeth Ríos es una socia que venD. productos D. acuerdo a la estación, por ejemplo en invierno venD. turrones y miel D. abeja, y en verano se dedica a la venta D. productos naturales. Este tipo D. negocio le ha traído muchos beneficios ya que pueD. sustentar los gastos en casa. 
Los socios D. este grupo tienen diferentes actividades tales como venta D.  comida, venta D. cosméticos, productos naturales, venta D. ropa, servicios D. sastrería. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda pero gracias a su experiencia, pueden salir adelante vendiendo productos que van D. acorD. con las exigencias del mercado. 
Ellos solicitan financiamiento para la adquisición D. mercaderías, e insumos que les permitan generaran mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL EMPRENDEDORES D. SICUANI The communal bank "EMPRENDEDORES D. SICUANI" is represented by Mrs. Miguela C. and formed by 11 members who are in their fifth loan cycle, proving their responsibility, unity, honesty, and above all their desire to move forward in life. Mrs. Miguela C. has been working in the textile industry for many years, a business that has allowed her to proviD. education to her 4 children. The treasurer Elizabeth Ríos is a member that sells products according to the season. For example, in the winter she sells nougat candy and bee honey, and in the summer she sells natural products. This type of business has brought many benefits so she is able to support the household expenses. The members of this group have different activities such as food sales, cosmetic sales, natural products, clothing sales, and tailor services. As in any commercial industry, there is always the competition between supply and demand, but thanks to their experience, they can move forward selling products that sell according to the needs of the market. They are requesting financing for the acquisition of merchandise, and goods that will allow them to generate greater incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of inputs and products

loans.name: Ramona De La Concepción

texts.es:
Ramona O. se dedica a la venta de ropa exhibiendola en su establecimiento donde a diario es visitada por sus clientes que acuden para adquirir la ropa. Es de importancia destacar que ella ha logrado salir adelante gracias a sus esfuerzos por su negocio.

Actualmente, el crédito lo ha solicitado para dar lugar a la compra de la ropa ya que se le está agotando y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ramona O. sells clothing displayed at her store where she is visited everyday by her clients who come to shop for clothes. It is important to point out that she has been able to get ahead thanks to the effort put in the business. Currently, the loan requested is to purchase merchandise because her inventory levels are low and with the loan the conditions of the business will be better.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing merchandise

loans.name: Eulalia Modesta

texts.es: Eulalia Modesta M. tiene la edad de 51 años. Es madre soltera tiene 5 hijos y ninguno y todos trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que siempre le ha gustado ser una persona muy responsable, y disfruta de su trabajo ya que comparte con muchas personas. Ella solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para caballero, ropa para damas, cosméticos. Su mayor sueño es mantener su actividad económica ya que es el único medio de vida que ella tiene.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Carla Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Carla del Socorro M. se ha destacado por ser una excelente trabajadora el cuál se dedica al negocio de la venta de comida siendo preparada por ella misma con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación.

Ella prepara deliciosos platillos y es por esto que las personas le buscan para adquirir los alimentos. Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito oportuno para la compra de la materia prima y de esta manera elaborar dichos alimentos.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para elaborar alimentos

loans.name: Maria Teresita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Hermano Miguel se formó  hace ocho  años en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta es una ciudad muy hermosa y considerada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, ya que tiene muchos lugares hermosos y arquitectónicos para visitar, su gente es cordial y amable, éste banco comunal está conformada por 11 socias responsables,  alegres, colaboradoras y unidas, dispuestas a superarse en la vida  para bienestar propia y de su familia, en cada inicio de ciclo preparan un almuerzos para compartir un momento de amistad y alegría entre las socias.

La señora María Teresita  Y. Aviléz  es socia del banco comunal Hermano Miguel, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 51 años de edad, se encuentra felizmente casada, fruto de su amor concibió 8 hijos de 28, 26, 25, 24, 22, 20, 17, 14 años de edad, sus 3 primeros hijos se encuentran casados y viven independientemente con sus familias y sus 5 hijos estudian en el colegio Antonia Ávila, su esposo trabaja como conserje de una escuela, viviendo allí porque no tienen casa propia.

María trabaja como conserje junto a su esposo en una escuela contratada por los padres de familia por que aun no tiene el nombramiento,  lleva catorce años aunque solo está registrada como 13 años de que ha laborado, encontrándose un poco mal por que el sueldo es muy bajo.

Lleva ocho años trabajando junto a su  banco comunal, manteniendo una buena relación con todas las socias, además nos comenta que gracias  a los  préstamos a podido ayudarse para dar el  estudio a sus hijos.

El nuevo préstamo que realiza en la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR lo va ha invertir en los gastos del regreso a clases de sus hijos, nos comenta que ha trabajado para sus hijos toda su vida.

El sueño de María  es ver a sus hijos convertidos en  profesionales y también llegar a construirse su casa propia
texts.en:
The Hermano Miguel Community Bank was created eight years ago in the city of Cuenca. It is a very beautiful city and is considered a cultural heritage site because of its beautiful architecture. The people are cordial and friendly. The Community Bank has eleven members who are responsible, happy, collaborative, and united. They are aiming to succeed in life for their own well being and that of their family. At the beginning of every cycle, they have a lunch together, to share a moment of friendship and happiness. María Teresita Y. Aviléz is member of the Hermano Miguel Community Bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, is 51 years old, and is happily married with 8 children, aged 28, 26, 25, 24, 22, 20, 17, and 14. Her first 3 children are married and live on their own with their families. The younger 5 children go to the Antonia Ávila School. Her husband works as the caretaker of a school, living there because they do not have their own house. María works with her husband at the school. The parents contract her because the school has not yet officially hired her. She has worked there 14 years but has only gotten credit for 13 years, and she is dissatisfied with the low pay. She has been working with the communal bank for 8 years, maintaining a good relationship with all the other members. Thanks to loans from the bank, she has been able to help her children to attend school. María will use this new loan from FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR for education expenses for the children. She has worked for her children all her life. María’s dreams are that her children become professional people, and to build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education expenses for her children

loans.name: Manuel Joaquín

texts.es:
En un establecimiento del mercado central del departamento de Chinandega, el señor Manuel P. se dedica a atender el negocio de venta de revistas y de libros de segunda mano. Los productos son ofrecidos todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

El señor Manuel ha solicitado un crédito con el fin único de invertirlo directamente en la compra de las revistas para continuar ofertándolas y así continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
In a sector of the central market located in the department of Chinandega, Mr. Manuel P. works in the business of selling second handed magazines and books. The products are offered every day since early in the morning until the afternoon. Mr. Manual requested a loan with the only purpose of investing it directly in the purchase of magazines to continue offering them and this way continue to bring money to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy books and magazines

loans.name: Lucrecia Eduviges

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Lucrecia Eduviges C. se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos siendo este el negocio que ella posee y por el cual le genera ganancias para mantener su hogar.

Ella a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha venido mejorando su condición apoyándose de los créditos. Hoy en día solicita un crédito mas para la compra de los electrodomésticos y así continuar esforzándose por el bienestar de su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucretia Eduviges Caceres runs her own business, selling appliances In the State of Chinandega. This is her source of income to support her family.

She has been improving her business and style of life thanks to the loans. She is currently asking for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of appliances to keep working hard for the welfare of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Las Labradoras Group

texts.es:
Rafaela del Socorro M. F., Leonor Emilia C., Marbelly  del Carmen R. y Ericka Fabiola M. C. son las integrantes del grupo Dios es Amor. Ellas viven en barrio San Judas de Managua.

Rafaela del Socorro M. F. de 58 años es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella  tiene una pequeña pulpería donde vende queso, granos básicos entre otros productos de uso para el hogar y los fines de semana vende sopa. M. comenzó con este negocio para tener independencia y sobre vivir.  Ella desea ampliar su pulpería e invertir en fritanga. 

Las otras integrantes son Leonor Emilia C. de 65 años vende atolillo, un postre nicaragüense a base de maíz y especies, Marbelly  del Carmen R. de 65 vende carne y verduras, Arlen del Carmen T. G. que vende ropa y Ericka Fabiola M. C. de 33 tiene una pequeña pulpería.

loans.use: para comprar granos básicos y carne

loans.name: Lidia Rosa

texts.es: Lidia Rosa L. A. tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. Su actividad económica es la compra de mercadería en general. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que fue una necesidad primordial ya que tenía que alimentar a sus 2 hijos, por lo que no tenia ingresos suficientes para salir adelante. Por lo que decide iniciar a ofrecer a ciertos vecinos cosméticos, y poco a poco aumenta su mercadería con las ganancias que obtenía con este negocio y así logro comprar artículos como bolsos, calzado y ropa en general. Lidia ha sido una mujer que ha luchado fuertemente por sobresalir. Ahora solicita este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en capital de trabajo. su deseo es que su hija logre finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lidia Rosa L. A. is a 38 years old, hard working, responsible woman. She is dedicated to the purchase of general merchandise, and has been in this business for about 18 years.

She started her business because she didn’t have enough income and had to feed her 2 children. She started by offering cosmetics to some of her neighbors and with the profits obtained, she increased the line of products to handbags, shoes and clothes in general.

Lydia is a woman who has fought hard to excel. She is asking for a loan that will be used as working capital. Her goal is for her daughter to graduate from school.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rosa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Rosa de los Ángeles P. M. tiene la edad de 50 años. Es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad. Por lo que dio inicio con la venta de ropa como ropa para niños, para damas, para caballero y trajes formales, ella se levantaba todos los días por lo que tenía que trabajar muy temprano para viajar a Managua en busca de ropa, ya que es aquí donde la consigue de manera favorable y logro obtener muy bueno lugares en donde encuentra muy favorable los productos. Así con el tiempo fue adquiriendo más productos para distribuirlos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cosméticos, calzado y ropa en general. El deseo de Rosa es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa de los Angeles M. P. is a 50 years old, very responsible and hardworking woman. She is devoted to the sale of general merchandise and has been in this humble activity for more than 4 years.

She started selling cloths for kids, women, men and formal attire. She used to get up early every morning to travel to Managua to look for clothes, as there she gets a better price there.

She is asking for a loan that will be used as working capital for the purchase of cosmetics, footwear and clothing in general. Rosa's desire is to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Caital

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the group coordinator of the Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Mujeres Poderosas (Powerful Women). Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Haitian (many of whom have recently immigrated to the Dominican Republic) and Dominican clients. The group is based in Puerto Plata, a small rural zone that has basic, but unreliable, electricity and running water.

Maritza lives with her husband and has three sons. She is a professional cosmetologist and runs a beauty salon. She will use this loan to purchase additional beauty supplies and cosmetics. She hopes to one day have a better salon that is bigger.

Maritza has successfully repaid three loans and this is her fourth loan with Esperanza. These loans have helped to improve her quality of life and have enabled her to make investments.

loans.use: To buy additional beauty supplies and cosmetics

loans.name: Jesus Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Maria is the group coordinator of the Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Jesus Nuestra Esperanza (Jesus our Hope). Her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian (many of whom recently emigrated from Haiti to the DR) and Dominican clients generally. Their group is based in Puerto Plata, on the North Coast of the Dominican Republic in an area where they do not have running water.

This is Maria's second loan with Esperanza and she will be using it to buy more fruit for her stand, which she hopes to grow to a larger, more stable business with a bigger client base and more products.

With the profits from her business, Maria would like to buy some new clothes as well as continue investing in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit for her stall

loans.name: Mary Luz Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo Mary Luz son Mary Luz U., María Auxiliadora M. M. y Tania María V. C.. Ellas viven en barrio Loma linda de Managua.

Mary Luz U. de 56 años es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de videos y mp3, impresiones, fotocopias, levantado de texto y video juegos. Ella invertirá el crédito en la adquisición de nuevos equipos y video juegos.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Auxiliadora Mendez M. de 43 años ella tiene una pulpería y Tania María Vílchez C. de 25 años tiene un taller de costura.

loans.use: la adquisición de nuevos equipos y video juegos

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: La señora Rosa M. de 40 años, es una mujer que desde joven trabaja para sobresalir a delante junto con su familia, su negocio es la venta de comida que desde hace diez años administra con su esposo, reside en el bario Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua,  tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian la primaria uno tiene 7 y 12 años de edad, cuando inicio el negocio lo hico con un poco de ahorro y préstamo en grupo solidario, luego con el tiempo opto por prestar en Afodenic en donde lleva cuatro ciclos, y se ha beneficiado por la taza baja de intereses y para mantener sus ventas. Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos y perecederos para aumentar la venta de comida y poder obtener mejores ganancias para poder terminar de hacer su casa, poder apoyar  a sus hijos para que estudien ya que yo no tuve la oportunidad por escasos recursos económicos que mis padres tener. Su objetivo es poder tener un cafetín y poder seguir a delante en mejores condiciones. Agradece a la institución por el financiamiento que ha logrado estar en su negocio firme.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is 40 years old, and is a woman who has worked to move forward together with her family since she was young. She has a business in food sales that she has been managing with her husband for ten years. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She has two children in primary school, who are 7 and 12 years old. When she began the business, she did it with little savings and with a group loan. Later on, she applied to borrow with Kiva partner Afodenic and is now on the fourth loan cycle. She has benefited from the low interest rates and maintained her sales. With this loan she will purchase basic grains and perishable goods to increase her food sales and be able to earn greater earnings, finish constructing her house, and support her children's studies. This way, it is not as though she will not have the opportunity because of limited economic resources like her parents had. Her objective is to be able to have a cafe and move forward in better conditions. She thanks the institution for the financing that has allowed her to achieve her steady business.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and perishables

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es:
Enriqueta S. P., tiene 65 años de edad, tiene un negocio de venta de regalos para diferentes ocasiones, y tambièn vende papel china por mayor para la elaboraciòn de barriletes, en estos meses de septiembre, octubre, noviembre tiene una gran demanda de este tipo de papel ya que en Santiago Sacatepequez donde ella vive hay una festividad importante de barriletes gigantes, es por eso que ella quiere aprovechar estos meses, tiene bien surtido con colores y cantidades de papel que sus clientes le piden, y la venta de regalos para noviembre y diciembre también tiene bastante demanda por las festividades que celebran en esos meses.
Su negocio comenzó hece 8 años, y poco a poco ha ido mejorando, con el crédito anterior que recidiò de Kiva ella dice que le ayudo mucho, porque comprò muchas cosas que la gente le pedìa en el negocio. Por otra parte doña  Enriqueta también, invierte en su siembra de verduras ya que es una época de lluvia y es buena temporada de siembra, Es por eso que nuevamente que solicita su apoyo para poder hacer crecer su negocio, porque es una gran ayuda que se le brinda con el crédito, su sueño es hacer que crezca se negocio.
texts.en:
Enriqueta S. P. is 65 years old and has a gift shop business. She also sells tissue at wholesale that is used to make kites. There is a high demand during the months of September, October, and November for this type of paper as in Santiago Sacatepequez where she lives they have an important giant kites holiday. She wants to take advantage of these months and stock her business with colors and quantities of paper that her customers want. The gift shop also has a high demand for the holidays celebrated during November and December.

She started her business 8 years ago and has been improving it little by little. She states that her previous Kiva loan helped a lot, because she was able to buy many things that her customers asked for. Moreover Mrs. Enriqueta also plants vegetables during the rainy seasonsince it is good for planting. This is why she is asking again for a loan. Her dream is to grow her business

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: La señora Maria Ester P. M., tiene la edad de 36 años, habita en el barrio San Caralampio, ubicado en La Concepción Masaya, junto a su esposo el  cual trabaja como transportista para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene dos hijas  a su cargo actualmente estudiantes, la mayor de sus hijas en sus tiempos libres le apoya con el negocio, doña Maria desde hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos , antes de lograr establecerlo trabajaba como domestica en una casa privada , lo cual no le permitió estar juntos a su pequeñas y cuidarla .Ahora ella le agradece a nuestra institución por el apoyo que le ha brindado durante siete ciclo el cual invertirá en comprar ropa variada para ofertar a sus clientes. con mucho esfuerzo ha visto resultados ya que logro ampliar parte de su sala que ocupaba la tienda y ahora cuenta con un poco mas de privacidad. En un futuro quiere hacer un establecimiento solo para su tienda.

loans.use: Comprar ropa variada

loans.name: Rey De Reyes Group

texts.es:
Virginia del Carmen R., Ayda Lea G. y Mirna María L. M. son las que le dan vida al grupo Rey de Reyes. Ellas viven en el asentamiento anexo Camilo Ortega de Managua. 

Virginia del Carmen R. de 40 años es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella vende lecha, gas y carbón y lo que más desea es aumentar su negocio. Ayda Lea G. de 33 años por su parte vende helado, hielo, fresco y gaseosas.

Mientras Mirna María L. M. de 28 años tiene una fritanga en su casa, la fritanga es un restaurante popular por excelencia en Nicaragua. Este consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos, que están preparados solo para poner en la parrilla, por lo generar se comprar para la cena. Salgado es la coordinadora del grupo   y lo que más desea es mejorar el local de su negocio y seguir trabajando por su familia.
texts.en:
Virginia del Carmen Rodriguez, Ayda Read Mirna G. and Maria Lopez M. are the ones that promote the “Rey de Reyes“ group. They live in the Camilo Ortega area in Managua.

Virginia del Carmen Rodriguez is 40 years old and the coordinator of the group. She sells milk, gas and coal, and what she wants the most is to grow her business.

Ayda Lea G. is 33 years old and sells ice cream, ice and soft drinks.

Mirna María L. M. is 28 years old and has a fried food business at home. The fry food restaurants are very popular in Nicaragua. The fried meals are precooked and only need to be on the grill, so people usually buy them for dinner. Salgado is the coordinator of the group and what she wants the most is to improve her business and continue working for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Luz Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo Luz Gisely del Socorro L., Rosa María Pérez y Gloria del Socorro 

V.. Ellas viven en barrio Camilo Ortega de Managua.


Luz Gisely del Socorro L. de 35 años es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella tiene una pequeña 

pulpería  la cual quiere ver crecer y ser prospera. Rosa María Pérez de 36 años vende cosméticos  y 

Gloria del Socorro V. de 58 años vende comida y nacatamales.
texts.en:
The members of this group are Luz Gisely del Socorro L., Rosa María Pérez, and Gloria del Socorro V.. They live in the Managua neighborhood of Camilo Ortego.

Luz Gisely del Socorro L. is 35 years old and the group coordinator. She owns a small grocery store that she wants to see grow and prosper. Rosa María Pérez is 36 years old and sells cosmetics. Gloria del Socorro V. is 58 years old and sells food and nacatamales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains & household products

loans.name: Oreste Javier

texts.es: El señor Oreste Javier M. , tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el barrio Francia N0 1 , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante , ellos tiene tres hijos de 16,14 y 8 años actualmente los tres estudian y le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas , don Oreste desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura ya con sus propios esfuerzos logro comprar un terreno; el cual le sirve como fuente de trabajo y se siente muy agradecido con  Afodenic ya que le  ha apoyado durante seis ciclo de producción ,  en ocasiones  la afectación mas grande que se le presenta con el cultivo son las cenizas del volcán ya que esto le ha ocasionado perdidas en su producto. Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo y mejorar la producción y a si poder ofrecer a buen precio en el M..

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es: José de la Cruz Narváez M. tiene 28 años, es un  joven muy dedicado a su trabajo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este trabajo. El tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, y con su esposa luchan juntos para proporcionarles a sus hijos lo necesario. Inicialmente solo ofrecía jugos, bolistas y pan ya que no tenía el capital suficiente para salir adelante pero José es un hombre muy luchador y siempre su Mama le enseño a que debía de trabajar de manera muy honrada y administrando el negocio de una manera muy adecuada. El solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, pan, jugos, refrescos naturales, golosinas y productos de limpieza. El sueño de José es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
José de la Cruz Narváez M. is 28 years old and dedicated to his work. He has managed a grocery store for more than 5 years. With two children to support, he and his wife struggle to provide everything they need. At first he only offered juices, popsicles and bread because he did not have sufficient capital for his business to get ahead. However, José is a fighter. His mother always taught him how to work honorably and manage his business effectively.

The loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy basic grains, bread, juices, natural beverages, candy, and cleaning supplies. José dreams of making improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to restock his store with more merchandise

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  Las Caleras está ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca al sur del Ecuador, ésta es una ciudad muy hermosa,  tiene muchos lugares turísticos, sus iglesias y su centro histórico, sus ríos, por lo cual  es considerada como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable y educada.

La señora María Margarita O. I.  es una de las doce socias  del Banco Comunal Las Caleras, son señoras muy alegres y dispuestas a salir adelante con sus familias, ella vive vía al Tejar en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 52 años de edad y se encuentra felizmente casada, procreó tres  hijos de 29, 28, 22 años de edad, los dos  primeros son casados y viven en sus casas,  su última hija es madre soltera, estudia Turismo en la Universidad de Cuenca,  su esposo trabaja como taxista. Su vivienda es propia fruto del esfuerzo de su trabajo conyugal.

María trabaja vendiendo cosméticos y productos Yambal puerta a puerta, lleva cuatro años en su negocio y cuenta con  una clientela fija, argumenta que le va bien, siendo muy sacrificado pues tiene que recorrer la ciudad a pie para visitar a sus clientes de casa en casa,  su mayor dificultad es el clima pues cuando llueve no puede realizar sus actividades normales.

María lleva cinco años trabajando con la fundación,  sintiéndose muy agradecida ya que con los préstamos recibidos ha logrado mejorar las condiciones económicas de su hogar y de su negocio;  con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de un stock completo de cosméticos para incrementar su negocio e ir creciendo día a día.

Su sueño es  remodelar su casa porque le está quedando muy pequeña para toda su familia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Las Caleras is located in the city of Cuenca in the south of Ecuador. This is a very beautiful city with many touristic places, its churches and historic downtown, and its rivers, for which it is considered a Cultural World Heritage site. Its people are kind and educated. Mrs. Maria Margarita O. I. is one of twelve members of the Communal Bank Las Caleras. These are very happy women, determined to get ahead with their families. She lives in Via al Tejar in the city of Cuenca, is 52 years old, and happily married. She has three children, 29, 28, and 22 years of age. The two eldest are married and live in their own homes, and the youngest daughter is a single mom and studies Tourism in the University of Cuenca. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Her house is the product of their work together as a couple. Maria works selling cosmetics and Yambal products door to door. She has had her business for four years and has a fixed clientele. She argues that she does well, through with a lot of sacrifice since she has to go around the city on foot to visit her customers from house to house. Her greatest difficulty is the weather because when it rains she cannot carry on her normal activities. Maria has been working with the foundation for five years. She feels very grateful because with the loans she has received she has been able to improve the financial situation in her home and her business. With the new loan that Fundacion Espoir will give her she will invest in buying a complete stock of cosmetics to increase her business and grow day to day. Her dream is to remodel her home because it has become too small for all her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a complete stock of cosmetics to grow her business

loans.name: Concepción Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo  Concepción son María de la Concepción P., Eveling María L. y Rosalía P.. Ellas viven en barrio Altagracia de Managua.

María de la Concepción P. de 61 años es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella es costura y puso su taller de costura y decoración de fiesta  desde hace tres meses. En este último ella diseña y elabora piñatas y centros de mesas entre otros, alquila sillas, mesas y manteles. 

Mientras Eveling María L. de 26 años vende cosméticos de la Zermat y ropa y Rosalía P. María Cruz Guzmán de 29 años vende cosméticos, ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
The members of the Concepción Group are María de la Concepción P., Eveling María L., and Rosalía P.. They live in the Altagracia neighborhood of Managua.

María de la Concepción P. is 61 years old and the group coordinator. She is a seamstress who has been operating both a sewing workshop and a party decoration service for the past 3 months. In her second business, she designs and makes piñatas and table centerpieces. She also rents out chairs, tables, and tablecloths.

Eveling María L. is 26 years old and sells clothing and Zermat cosmetics. Rosalía P. María Cruz Guzmán is 29 years old and sells cosmetics, clothing, and shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials such as paper, cardboard, glue and fabrics

loans.name: Maria Grimanesa

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras está formado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, con visión hacia un futuro mejor, adoptando de la vida las mejores oportunidades para salir adelante,  las socias  viven en diferentes partes del centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ésta es una ciudad muy hermosa y milenaria teniendo muchos lugares turísticos para visitar y enamorarse de la belleza que esta ciudad encierra.

La señora María Grimanesa Ávila vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra casada, concibió 3 hijos de: 35, 30, 22 años de edad, dos de ellos se encuentran casados y viven independientemente con sus propias familias, mientras que la última se separo de su esposo por lo que ella y su niña viven en casa de sus padres, su hija trabaja para los gastos de su bebe por lo que no puede aportar siempre con los gastos de la casa, el esposo de María trabaja como taxista, aún no tienen casa propia.

María debe distribuir su tiempo en el cuidado de su nieta de 8 años y su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comida como: caldos, gelatina de pichón, humitas, tamales, etc.  sus clientes le hacen el pedido por teléfono, nos comenta que los caldos vende sólo los domingos en el mercado.

María trabaja junto a la fundación por diez años y se ha  beneficiado con los préstamos  recibidos pues  ha invertido en el negocio incrementado su capital. El crédito solicitado esta ocasión es para comprar menaje de cocina y artículos desechables  para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su propio negocio para poder pasar más tiempo con sus nietas.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Luchadores is made up of a group of female entrepreneurs who hope to build themselves a better future by seizing every opportunity to move forward. The partners live in different parts of the center of the city of Cuenca. This is a very beautiful and historic city, with many tourist sites to visit. Many fall in love with the beauty of this mountain town. Mrs. María Grimanesa Ávila lives in the center of the city of Cuenca, she is married, and has three children aged 35, 30, and 22-years-old respectively. Two of them are married and live independently with their own families, while the last is separated and lives with her daughter in her parents' house. This daughter works to cover the expenses of her baby so she can't always help with the household expenses. Maria's husband works as a taxi driver, and they don't own their house. Maria divides here time between caring for her 8-year-old granddaughter and her business. She sells food like soup, pigeon gelatin, humitas (corn paste wrapped in corn leaves), and tamales. Her clients order by phone except for her soups, which she only sells on Sunday at the market. Maria has worked with the foundation for ten years and has benefited from her past loans. She has invested in her business, increasing her capital. This particular loan is to buy household cooking tools and disposable items to offer better service to her clients. Her greatest dream is to have her own business in order to spend more time with her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra menaje de cocina y articulos desechables

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmen Ramona

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras está formado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, con visión hacia un futuro mejor, adoptando de la vida las mejores oportunidades para salir adelante,  las socias  viven en diferentes partes del centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ésta es una ciudad muy hermosa y milenaria teniendo muchos lugares turísticos para visitar y enamorarse de la belleza que esta ciudad encierra.

La señora  Carmen  Ramona C. vive en la ciudad de Cuenca en el centro de la urbe, tiene 39 años de edad, se encuentra casada concibió 3 hijos de 22, 18, 9 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive hace varios años en el extranjero, su hijo estudia en el Instituto Infeyal y su última hija en el Centro Educativo Nuevo Milenio, Carmen mantiene una buena relación con su esposo, él es técnico en refrigeración actividad que le ha permitido aportar económicamente para su hogar, aún  no tienen casa propia y viven en casa de su madre.

 Carmen trabaja en un gabinete de belleza y lleva varios años trabajando en este difícil  arte y los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de  ropa de segunda mano, viaja para el Triunfo a vender su mercadería, nos cuenta que existen días buenos y malos pero siempre deja una pequeña ganancia para llevar el pan a su hogar, lleva 18 años en su negocio.

Carmen Trabaja junto a su banco comunal doce  ciclos  y la relación entre las socias es muy buena porque son un grupo solido. Ella manifiesta que gracias a los créditos recibidos  ha logrado invertir en el taller de su esposo comprando repuestos para las refrigeradoras.

Con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue va a invertir en la compra de refrigeradoras dañadas  para arreglarlas y dejarlas como nuevas para sacarlas a la venta.

Su sueño es llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Luchadores is made up of a group of female entrepreneurs who hope to make themselves a better future by seizing any opportunity to move forward. The partners live in different parts of the center of the city of Cuenca. This is a very beautiful and historic city, with many tourist sites to visit. Many fall in love with the beauty of this mountain city. Mrs. Carmen Ramona C. lives right in the city of Cuenca, is 39-years-old, is married with thre children aged 22, 18, and 9-years-old. Her eldest daughter is married and has lived abroad for many years. Her son studies at the Infeyal Institute and her youngest daughter studies in the Nuevo Milenio Educational Center. Carmen has a healthy relationship with her husband, who is a refrigerator technician. This activity has allowed him to economically support his household although they don't have their own home and live in his mother's house. Carmen works in a beauty salon, and has worked in this dificult artistic field for many years. On weekends, she travels to el Triunfo to sell second-hand clothing. She tells us that there are good days and bad days, but this work always leaves her a small profit to bring home the bacon. She's had this business for 18 years. Carmen has worked with the communal bank for twelve cycles and the relationship between the partners is very good because the group is strong. She states that thanks to the credit she has received, she has been able to invest in her husband's workshop, buying refrigerator replacement parts. With the loan that FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR is giving her, she is going to invest in the purchase of broken refrigerators to repair them and leave them as good as new in order to sell them. Her dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de refrigeradoras dañadas para arreglarlas y venderlas

loans.name: Pedro Ismael

texts.es: El señor Pedro Ismael Velásquez tiene la edad de 67 años,  habita en el barrio las Enramadas, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ellos tienen seis hijos todos independientes, desde hace 31 años don Pedro trabaja como agricultor ya que sus padres le facilitaron el terreno para poderlo a trabajar y mantener a sus hijos , le agradece a AFODENIC, ya que a través de los fondo KIVA, le han apoyado durante diez ciclos para obtener una mejor producción y realizar sus proyecto , antes de este apoyo a don Velásquez se le dificultaba vender su cultivo ya que este carecía de insumos necesarios y fertilizantes . Lo cual le afectaba económicamente y no le permitía avanzar. Comprara fertilizantes y aplicara  sus cultivos para mejorar la producción.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo

loans.name: Yesenia Benita

texts.es: Yesenia Benita V. Pacheco tiene 33 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Por lo que siempre tiene que ir a Managua en busca de los productos, por lo que ella recorre los diferentes mercados y algunas comarcas y así todos los días se levanta muy temprano pues tiene alistar sus bolsos y mercadería para ofrecerles a sus clientes su gran variedad de productos. Actualmente ella está solicitando el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para caballeros, cosméticos, ropa para damas y para niños. Su mayor deseo es obtener un carro para brindar el servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
Yesenia Benita V. Pacheco is 33 years old. She works selling general merchandise. For more than 8 years now she has worked in this business. She is responsible for her 3 children, which is why she always has to go to Managua to look for products to sell, going to different markets and regions. Every day she wakes up very early to ready her bags and merchandise to offer to her customers a great variety of products. She is currently requesting financing for working capital to buy men's clothing, cosmetics, and clothes for women and children. Her greatest wish is to buy a car to offer a taxi service.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Laura Clemencia

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras está formado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, con visión hacia un futuro mejor, adoptando de la vida las mejores oportunidades para salir adelante,  las socias  viven en diferentes partes del centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ésta es una ciudad muy hermosa y milenaria teniendo muchos lugares turísticos para visitar y enamorarse de la belleza que esta ciudad encierra.


La señora Laura  Clemencia C. vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 70 años de edad, es casada y procreó  ocho hijos, todos se encuentran casados viven independientes con sus respectivas familias, su esposo es mecánico pero por su edad solo trabaja horas en su antiguo taller; aún  no tienen casa propia por lo que tienen que arrendar.

Laura tiene un negocio de venta ropa americana de segunda mano, lleva 25 años en esta actividad, los sábados y domingos recorre todas las ferias de la ciudad para realizar sus ventas.

Laura  es una señora muy tierna y dulce, se lleva bien con todas las socias, trabaja con la fundación hace 5 ciclos y le han ayudado para surtir su negocio, con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería surtida para todos los gustos y edades

Su sueño es de seguir trabajando hasta que Dios le permita.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank 'Mujeres Luchadoras' is formed by a group of entrepreneur women that aim for a better future, and go after the best opportunities to get ahead in life. The members live in different parts of Cuenca, a beautiful and historical city with several touristic attractions. Mrs. Laura Clemencia C. lives in downtown Cuenca, is 70 years old, married and has raised 8 children, all now independent and with their own families. Her husband is a mechanic, but because of his advanced age he only works a few hours a week in his old workshop; they have to pay rent as they still don't own a house. Laura sells second hand clothing from the US, and she's been in this business for the past 25 years. On Saturdays and Sundays she goes around all street fairs in the city to sell her clothes. Laura is a very sweet and tender person and she gets along with all the other members of the foundation, where she's been part of for the past 5 years, and they have helped her improve her business. With the loan she's asking from the Espoir Foundation, she is planning on buying more merchandise for all ages and tastes. She dreams on keep working for as long as God allows her to.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to resell in local markets

loans.name: Las Conejitas 1 Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo LAS CONEJITAS 1 son Eveling Aninta R., Juana Ismael H. R. y Maribel del Socorro L.. Ellas viven en barrio Arlen Zequeira de Managua.

Eveling Aninta R. de 31 años es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella desde hace cinco años tiene una pulpería que gracias a los créditos está bien surtida. Ella desea remodelar la tienda e introducir nuevos productos como ropa, sandalias y cosméticos.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son  Juana Ismael H. R. quien vende ropa y Maribel del Socorro L.  quien tiene un fritanga que es un restaurante popular y vende gaseosa.
texts.en:
The members of the group, "Las Conejitas I" ["Little Rabbits I"], are Eveling Anita R., Juana Ismael H. R. and Maribel de Socorro L.. They live in the neighborhood, Arlen Zequeira, in Managua. Eveling Aninta R. is 31 years old and is the coordinator of the group. She has owned a general store for five years, which thanks to her loans has a wide variety of products. She would like to remodel the store and introduce new products such as clothing, sandals, and cosmetics. The other members of the group are Juana Ismael H. R., who sells clothing, and Maribel del Socorro L., who has a fast food restaurant that is popular and sells soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new products such as shampoo, clothing, sandals, and basic grains

loans.name: Consuelo Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo  Consuelo son Consuelo del Carmen F. C., Judith  Elena M. G. y Brunildo del Carmen C.. Ellas viven en barrio Altagracia de Managua.

Consuelo del Carmen F. C. es la coordinadora del grupo, ella antes viajaba y tenía un tramo en el mercado de productos de belleza pero con la muerte de su esposo ella vendió su tramo se quedo como distribuidora.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Judith  Elena M. G. que vende ropa y cosméticos y Brunildo del Carmen C., el vende frijoles y verduras.

loans.use: compra de cosmetico como pintura labial, de uñas, lapiz de ceja, deliniador... etc

loans.name: Cesar Javier

texts.es:
El señor Cesar Javier M. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos pequeños de edad que les quiere dar lo mejor y un lugar seguro donde vivir.
Es por eso que nos está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar la diferencia que tiene para poder obtener una casa por medio de un crédito Gubernamental, ya que actual mente vive en casa de sus suegras. Desea que su familia tenga ya su propia casa y un cuarto especial para sus niños. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su empleo en una fábrica en el departamento de producción.
texts.en:
Cesar Javier M. is the father of two small children. He wants to give his children the best he can and a safe place to live. It's for this reason that he is requesting a loan, so that he can pay the difference that is necessary to buy a house with a government loan, given that he currently lives in his in-laws' house. He wishes for his family to have their own house and a special room for his children. He plans to repay the loan with income that he obtains from his factory job in the department of production.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the difference of the price of a house that will be partially covered by Infonavit [a government institution]

loans.name: Profetisa

texts.en:
Profetisa E. is from the town of Katipunan, Guipos,Zambo.del Sur. She is 60 years old. Profetisa is married. To make a living, Profetisa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Profetisa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Profetisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Profetisa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Profetisa is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Profetisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Mrs.Editha M. is from the village of Rizalina,Rizal  ZN.She is married and blessed with 5 children who  were  in adult-aged. She joined PMPC last October 20, 2006 in order to access their programs and services of  the   said  coop.
Recently, she's availing her 5th cycle loan in the amount of 10,000.00  for  the purpose of pawning a parcel of cocoland.

loans.use: For pawn a parcel of  cocoland

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva S. is from Pagadian City. She is 32 years old. Eva is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Eva is just starting this business.

Eva joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Eva is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in future. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Eva from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita L. is from Pagadian City. She is 35 years old. Perlita is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Perlita owns and operates a specialized service business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Perlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Perlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine F. is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 38 years old. Josephine is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 9,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fenancia

texts.en:
Fenancia N. is from the village of Singclot, Guipos, Zambo del Sur. She is 49 years old. Fenancia is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Fenancia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from cultivating fruit trees and harvesting their fruit for sale. Fenancia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Fenancia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fenancia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Fenancia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Fenancia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Elvita

texts.en:
Elvita C. is from the village of So. Pob. She is 50 years old. She is married. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.

In 2008, Elvita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional piglets to raise and sell in the future. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Elvita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets for raising

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde A. is from the town of Guipos, Zambo. Del Sur. She is 54 years old. Matilde is married and has 1 adult-aged children. To make a living, Matilde owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Matilde has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 12,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina P. R. de 24 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Paz, junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Ella posee su propio negocio en el cual se dedica a comercializar productos de primera necesidad, como cereales, leche, entre otros productos más. A pesar que su esposo posee un trabajo fijo, Carolina vela por el bienestar de su hijo, es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo, ya que desea aumentar los productos de su negocio y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas, puesto que su mayor deseo es poder brindar una vida mejor a su hijo, supliendo con todas sus necesidades básicas.

loans.use: Compra de productos para su negocio.

loans.name: Elías

texts.es: Elías A. R. de 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, en Perquín en el departamento de Morazán, el se dedica a elaborar muebles para el hogar, y desde ya hace veinte años posee su propia carpintería, por medio de la cual ha logrado sostener a su extensa familia. Elías posee muy buenas referencias y es conocido como una persona humilde y trabajadora la cual se ha esforzado por brindarles todo lo mejor a sus cuatro hijos. El solícita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda comprar más madera para realizar su trabajo, ya que el trabaja por encargo, y también elabora muebles los cuales comercializa en su hogar.

loans.use: Compra de madera

loans.name: Juan Ángel

texts.es: Juan Ángel R. de 52 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Morazán junto a su esposa. El posee una venta de frutas, la cual la comercializa de manera ambulante en gran parte de la zona de Perquín. Juan solicita un préstamo para poder brindarle mantenimiento a su vehiculo, ya que es este el que le permite realizar su trabajo, así mismo lo solicita para obtener el dinero para poder comprar más fruta para su negocio. Juan es una persona muy honrada, el cual trabaja arduamente para obtener lo necesario para tener una vida digna junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Juan Ángel R. is 52 years old and lives in the departament of Morazán with his wife. He sells fruit commercially as a street vendor in a large part of the area of Perquín. Juan is applying for a loan to maintain his vehicle which is what allows him to work and obtain the money to purchase more fruit for his business. Juan is a very honorable person who works tirelessly to gain the necessities to lead a dignified life together with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit

loans.name: Galileo De Jesús

texts.es: Galileo de Jesús G. V. de 33 años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque, junto a su esposa y su hijo de ocho años de edad. El trabaja como vendedor ambulante, vendiendo productos varios como pegamentos, shampoo, crema para el pelo y otros productos más. Su esposa trabaja atendiendo una tienda y vende productos de catalogo, todo con la intensión de brindarle ayuda a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar. Galileo solicita un préstamo para capital de trabajo y así mismo para pagar algunos productos que comercializa.
texts.en:
Galileo de Jesus Gomez V. is 33 years old, and lives in Sensuntepeque with his wife and eight-year-old son. He works as a peddler, selling various products such as glue, shampoo, hair lotion, and other products. His wife works tending a store and sells products through catalogues, with the goal of offering help to her husband with the household expenses. Galileo is requesting a loan for working capital and to pay for some of the products he sells.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying new products

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.es: Cruz María I. I. de 39 años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque, junto a sus dos hijos de 10 y 12 años los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Cruz María se dedica a vender ropa para todo tipo de edad, así mismo comercializa aritos y pulseras  en el mercado municipal de Sensuntepeque. Cruz debe trabajar arduamente día con día, ya que es madre soltera y es ella quien debe brindarles todo lo necesario a sus pequeños hijos, los cuales dependen únicamente de su madre. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de obtener capital de trabajo y de esta manera surtir su negocio y así mismo mejorar sus ganancias, todo con el deseo de brindarles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cruz Maria I. is 39 years old and libes in Sensuntepeque with her two children who are 10 and 12 years old and are students. Cruz Maria works selling clothes for all ages, as well as selling earrings and bracelets in the municipal market of Sensuntepeque. Cruz must work arduously day after day because she is a single mother and it is her who has to offer her children everything they need because they depend solely on their mother. She is requesting a loan with the goal of obtaining working capital and in this way stock her business, thus increasing her profits with the hope to offer her children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothes to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa M. N. de 65 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a dos nietos en la ciudad de Soyapango. Ella se encarga de vender tamales de elote, los cuales ella misma los elabora, así mismo posee un molino en el cual las personas de las cercanías de su casa llegan a moler el maíz entre otros productos más. Doña Elisa es una señora que a pesar de su avanzada edad trabaja diariamente para poder llevar el alimento a su mesa, y es por esto que ella solícita un préstamo con el fin de obtener capital de trabajo y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Elisa M. N. is 65 years old and lives in her own house with two grandchildren in the city of Soyapango. She sells corn tamales which she makes herself. She owns a mill which is visited by people from nearby areas to mill corn, as well as other products. Doña Elisa is a woman who, in spite of her advanced age, works daily to be able to bring food to the table. This is why she is requesting a loan to obtain working capital to improve the condition of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying maize.

loans.name: Sari Tani Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu Nayu is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Brawantangi - Melaya. Ni Putu Nayu is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Sari Tani (DNR.M-0596).

Ni Putu Nayu is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Ni Putu Nayu owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni Putu Nayu has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 400.000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ni Putu Nayu joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Putu Nayu is requesting a loan from DINARI for the first time. She is now requesting 1.400.000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Putu Nayu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her immediate family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Ni Putu Nayu - (-) merupakan 49 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Brawantangi - Melaya. Ni Putu Nayu adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Sari Tani (DNR.M-0596). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Putu Nayu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu Nayu menghasilkan sekitar 0,400 IDR. Dalam 2009, Ni Putu Nayu bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Putu Nayu telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.400.000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva. ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

texts.en: Gendensuren is 27 years old and lives with his wife and three year old daughter in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Gendensuren started his business in 2004 with 3,000,000 tugrug (~2110 USD) of working capital which has since grown to 8,000,000 tugrug (~5620 USD) of working capital. He wants his family to have a more comfortable life and his daughter to get the highest education possible.  He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to buy more timber and logs in order to increase his sales.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn A., who lives in the village of Barangay 2A, Manapla, Negros Occidental, is 40 years old and married to Leo A. who presently works as a fish broker in the “pala-pala” - the wholesale fish market. They have five school-age children. Jocelyn loves her husband and children so much that she want to give them a good future and to help her husband to earn more. She decided to put up a business and have her own source of income. Because of her dream for her family, Jocelyn engaged in selling different breakfast foods in the wet market where her husband works. From this she earned a small income that helped to defray some of their family expenses. She continued her food vending business but she also continued to look at other business opportunities because she believed that expanding to other businesses will help her increase her income. In 2006, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to access additional capital which she used to set up a general store near the community basketball court which has high pedestrian traffic. Jocelyn has been in business for the past six years and now her entrepreneurial activities earn her a monthly income of PHP 12,500. This income goes to support the family's household expenses and the education of her children. In her previous loan, Jocelyn borrowed Php 19,500 which she used as additional capital for her business. For her 10th loan she is proposing to borrow Php 21,000 to be used again as additional capital. Whatever income she gets from this loan will be used for her family and for school expenses. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his family all live together in their ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His two oldest children attend secondary school while his youngest daughter stays at home with his wife.

Otgonbayar owns his own car and is a taxi driver in his town. He began his business in 2008 and has gained a lot of business experience in a short amount of time. He needs to keep his car in good condition so that he can continue to earn a living. Therefore, he is requesting a 1,100,000 tugrug loan in order for him to make the necessary repairs and to replace parts on his car.

loans.use: To make necessary repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en: Sherly V. is from the village of Locsoon,Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Sherly owns and operates a furniture-making business, making and selling home furniture to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Sherly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand her business. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. loans.name: Mrs. Loemheang Peurn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loemheang P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members in Ampil village in Kandal province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Loemheang P. is a farmer who owns a small field on which she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Saing Piseth, is a fisherman and he also charges batteries to earn an income.

In this business, her husband now faces a small problem because his generator is old so he needs to use a lot of fuel to run it. Thus, he wants to ask for a loan to buy a new generator to replace the old one. His wife decided to obtain the loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Loemheang P. is 34 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a new generator to replace the old one

loans.name: Namdag

texts.en: Namdag A. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and four year old son in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. A. currently operates a taxi service in his town. He started driving a taxi in 2008 with capital of 400,000 tugrugs (~280 USD) and has found success. He has used his earnings to stabilize his family's financial situation and improve their quality of life. He also was able to purchase a car which he uses as his taxi. Today A.'s working capital exceeds 800,000 tugrugs (~560 USD). For the future, he hopes to continue his business' stable operation so that he can provide for his son's education. He is requesting a 700,000 tugrug (~490 USD) loan to purchase auto-parts so he can make repairs to his car and continue to operate his taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Mrs. Phy Hong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people, who are located in Ampil village in Kandal province, make up this village bank loA. and all the members will use the loA. for different purposes. Mrs. Phy H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Phy H. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces a small problem because her field has infertile soil which is bad enough to affect the crop. So she decided to ask for a loA. to buy fertilizers and pesticide to support the field to make her crop more productive.

Mrs. Phy H.’s husband, Mr. Kheng A., is a pig breeder who is able to make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Phy H. is 51 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school.

Two members in this group loA. have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loA. until the very end of the loA. term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loA. term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide
